elements.text: [Part One]
Chanting and lots of hub-bub.
Ah, end of the line, old man?
Meta, get round his other side.
You’ve got no Game, Sharz. You know what I’m saying? You’re froth. Weak.
You expect me to just quit?
Nah, mate. Not till you’re eliminated. Won’t be long now. Neecham!
Bad luck, Neecham.
Right. Ain’t no big thing. I can still take you. You’re going down. Yeah, you are.
Hollis, shut up and play.
Clash of metal blades.
You're tired. Missed. Yeah! That’s it! Now it’s over. This one’s for Neecham, Sharz. I hope it really hurts.
Crowd cheers.
No. No! This ain’t your day, is it, Hollis? See you next time. (laughs)
Argh!
William Russel is humming.
Sir. Sir, please. Be quiet.
I didn’t say anything.
You were humming.
Do you want me to stop?
What do you think?
You don’t like me, do you, Ambassador Davis?
No. To be honest I think you’re a
Oh, not again. There’s not more Chicken Marasata.
What?
My stupid service robot forgot to restock my cooler thing again. I don’t know. Idiot.
Okay, look, I have been very patiently trying to brief you since before we left Earth. Can you please just shut up and listen?
I will shut up when I’m eating my Marasata. This is not my first time doing this, you know.
I realise that, but
Ambassador, trust me. It will all work out. It always works out. There’s really no point worrying.
At this rate we could miss the next peace window. Hundreds of people will die.
(sighs) Yes, of course. Proceed.

Thank you. We’re about to touch down on the planet Cray. For centuries Cray’s been home to a barbaric war between the planet’s two main social groups. Normally no big deal. Unfortunately, three cycles ago, the UI twinned Cray with Earth.
What does that mean, twinned?
They designated it Earth’s sister planet due to its position relative to ours from Galactic Zero.
Ah.
Thanks to the twinning, what had been just another civil war on just another hick planet is suddenly a major source of embarrassment.
And Earth Administration has had enough embarrassments without any help from hick planets. So, what are these two groups fighting over?
Well, apparently over a Game.
A Game?
Ah ha! Gotcha. No.
Why are you looking for a camera?
Who told you I was looking for a camera?
No one. But the last thing you said was I need to find my camera, and now you’re halfway inside that trunk.
It’s for our journey.
The trunk?
The camera. This camera. Smile, Nyssa.
Click, whirr.
What?
Very good. Here, shake that. Now, why haven't we arrived yet? Coordinates set. Come on, old girl, put your back into it. (thump) That’s better.
I’ve never seen you this excited, Doctor.
That’s because you’ve never seen me on holiday. Fancy joining me for a spot of Time Tourism?
What, again?
Again?
Well, I’m not complaining, but isn’t that what we always do?
Nyssa, my Tardis can take us anywhere, anywhen we want to go.
Yes, but sometimes I want to do more than just go.
I see.
I didn’t mean to upset you, Doctor. Where was it you wanted to take me?
The planet Cray.
Oh, sounds nice.
No, no, no, it’s dreadful. Sulphuric rivers, uninspired architecture. Even the most generous Galactic guides say give it a miss.
Which explains why you chose it for our holiday.
Don't be silly. Cray is where I will finally get to meet Darzil Carlisle.
Who?
Spacecraft lands.
Coach Destry.
Hollis, final results are in. It's no good. Get inside where I can hear you.
Door closes.
Well, what is it? Official results from yesterday? We outscored the Gora 340 to 291. They’re caving, Coach. In another few weeks we'll be Naxy champions. What’s wrong, Coach?
Now is not the time for this.
But that makes six straight wins.
Do you see that shuttlecraft, Hollis? It contains an Earth delegation which
One more decisive move is all we need to put them away. Let me challenge Sharz to a one-on-one. I almost had him yesterday.
Silence! Friends, welcome to Cray.
Bela Destry. So nice to finally meet you in the flesh.
Ambassador Davis, isn’t it?
That's right. And this is Earth’s Lord High Negotiator
Darzil Carlisle. I am honoured, sir, to have a luminary such as yourself here on Cray.
(sotto) Who is he?
Mister Destry coaches a Naxy team.
The Lineen, to be precise, and this is our star player, Hollis Az.
Sir.
Has he dropped something?
Hollis is bowing in your honour.

Well, don’t. Now, what I usually say at this point is that the world as you know it is about to come to an abrupt and utter demise, and there is absolutely nothing you can do to prevent it. Right, that’s out of the way. Is anyone else hungry?
The Tardis materialises. Tardis door opens.
You brought the camera, didn’t you?
It’s around your neck. (Tardis door closes.) Doctor, who is Darzil Carlisle?

Only one of the most eminent advocates for peace in human history. Born outside Olympus Mons on Mars in 2414, at the age of three, following a freak airlock accident that killed his parents, he was relocated to an orphanage in Finchley, north London. At 17 he earned a scholarship to the Phobos Academy of Music where he studied for three years before, quote unquote, stumbling into a glorious career as a peace negotiator.
You sound like quite a fan of this Darzil person.
Fan is, well, is... No, I prefer the term enthusiast.
So, he’s a Martian, then.
Technically, but still human. His parents were both from Earth.
Well, if he’s so important to you, why wait this long to meet him?
I suppose it’s because... Well, the thing is, Nyssa, I have a slight tendency to interfere.
No.
Cray is where Lord Carlisle settled his final peace negotiation before retiring, so I thought by now it would be safe just to sit in the back and watch him work his magic.
But if he’s a peace negotiator, wouldn’t that mean... we’re going to a war for a holiday.
Not a war, a peace.
What sort of war?
From what I understand, a particularly nasty one. It lasted centuries and affected every family on Cray several times over. By now the survivors must be experiencing almost unbearable anguish.
Chanting Gora, Gora.
You were saying?
Door opens.
(coughs) So smoky.
Door closes.
Sports pubs often are. And judging by the décor this is definitely a sports pub.
Doctor, those men.
Not exactly teetotallers, are they, unless they’re heavily disguised as shouty drunks.
Their skin, it’s so blue.
It’s face paint.
Face paint?
Throughout the cosmos it’s traditional to paint one’s face according to the colour of one’s team. Must be a match on today.
Silence falls.
They’re staring at us.
Splendid. Saves us the trouble of attracting their attention.
They’re coming over.
Ah. Hello. I’m the Doctor and this is my friend (thump!)
Doctor!
Is it to your liking, sir?
(mouth full) Hmm?
Your dinner.
What about it?
I. Oh, never mind.
Walks away
Is his Lordship ill?
Just tired from our journey. Lord Carlisle, Mister Destry has been an enormous help in setting up tomorrow’s talks.
Trying to bias me, is he?
Of course he isn’t trying to
I’ve seen all the tricks, and I can promise you that one never works.
Lord Carlisle.
No. No, it’s all right. Hollis, go and prepare for today’s match.
Right, Coach. (leaves)
Now I can speak freely. Sadly not everyone on Cray shares my views.
Meaning what, exactly?
The bloodshed here must end. My conscience can no longer stand it.
It takes both sides to end a war.
Pardon?
He means the other Coach. Sharz I believe he’s called?
Yes. I invited my counterpart to be present for your official welcome.
So where is he?
He would only say he had more pressing matters to attend to.
Lineen scum. Can you give me one good reason why I shouldn't eliminate you now? (thump)
Several hundred thousand, actually.
You've got nerve coming here, I'll give you that. Lineen don’t usually show that kind of bottle.
Stop it! Let him go! We’re not Lineen. We’re not even from Cray.
What?
We're here to see Darzil Carlisle.
Thud.
You're with this stupid delegation?
Not exactly with.
Not exactly stupid. He is here to stop a war, after alll.
War? There ain’t been a war on Cray in centuries.
Why else should he travel so far?
Dunno. Maybe he’s a Naxy fan.
What is Naxy?
You don’t know?
It’s a simple question, surely?
Naxy’s our global pastime, innit. We’re just off to play in todays match. Fancy coming along? We can always use another striker.
He doesn’t play.
Everybody plays Naxy, darling. Sooner or later.
So I can join your team just like that?
You can if the Coach of the Gora asks you to.
And that’s you.
That’s me. Sharz Sevix. Apologies for not introducing myself earlier.
You were busy strangling me earlier. I’m called the Doctor. This is Nyssa.
What do you say, Doctor? I'll teach you the basics myself.
Well, I suppose one Game won'’t kill me.
Great! And your little lady can join our cheerleaders. She’s certainly got the legs for it.
Of all the sexist
Excuse us, Sharz. Nyssa.
You're not really going with him?
He knows more than he’s letting on. When you mentioned Darzil Carlisle the other’s faces went all blank, but not Sharz’s.
You noticed that even as he was strangling you.
Mmm. And that he’s right-handed, smells of pickled onions and is featured on most of the Naxy posters hanging on these walls. There’s a war missing here, Nyssa.
You won't find it playing a silly Game.
I need to know what Sharz knows. Bonding over a Game of Naxy should do the trick.
Very well. But what about me?
Ready, Doctor?
Try and locate the Earth delegation. I'll join you later. Here, take the camera.
Here, lads, we’ve still got to paint the new boy’s face.
This isn’t necessary.
Have fun.
Here.
What are these?
Casualty reports. Fatality reports. Statistics, we call them. Well?
Hmm? Oh, yes. Very grim.
Is that all you can say?
What should I say? My honest reaction is, I’ve seen worse.
I’ve just shown you evidence that millions of lives have been lost. We need peace immediately, you miserable old oaf.
Nothing I do can bring those people back, which is why I prefer to focus on the future.
And what future do you see for us?
You know, Mister Destry, I haven’t the foggiest.
Yeah, I was thinking about it. We can definitely make that happen. Schedule the photoshoot. Yeah, I’m just walking there now. Oh! Watch it.
Excuse me.
Nah, it’s okay. Yeah, look, mate. No, I just bumped into someone. Listen, I'll talk to you after the Game, yeah? We'll sort it out. Cheers. Lost?
I’m looking for an Earth man named Darzil Carlisle.
Back there. Arena Hotel, 13" floor.
Thank you.
Ah ah. That area’s off-limits.
But I need to find him. Please let go of my arm.
What’s your name?
Nyssa.
Don’t you recognise me, Nyssa?
Should I?
Half the women on Cray would kill to spend five minutes with me.
I must belong to the other half. Ow! You’re hurting me.
It’s all right. No one’s around. We can talk. No harm in talking, right?
Sparring.
Not bad, Doctor. You learn fast.
Several planets have similar games. The stick looks like one used in an Earth Game called hockey.
You don’t say.
You don’t care.
Not in the slightest.
The way you use your stick is far more aggressive, though.
Wand.
Pardon?
It’s a wand. Stop calling it a stick.
Sharz?
Yeah?
Why is Darzil Carlisle on Cray?
I told you.
No, you didn’t. Oh!
You oughtn’t let your guard down, Doctor. (whistle blows) All right, lads. Go suit up. It’s bad form to keep our Lineen friends waiting for their beating.
Lineen? Back at the pub you thought I was a Lineen.
Yep.
And you nearly killed me.
Aren’t you glad you weren’t Lineen?
You hate them that much?
Hey, I don’t hate them, Doc. I just love to win.
You really don’t know who I am? Hollis Az, four time all-star?
No.
You’ve never watched Naxy, then.
I’ve only just heard of it.
Man, great for the ego you are.
Well, I
(laughs) No, it’s kind of nice. Everybody knows me as er, I dunno, the sort of guy I don’t always want to be. You know what I’m saying?
Er, I think so.
Good. Now explain it to me. So what do you want with that old Earth man. You’re too young and fine to be a bureaucrat.
My friend is very keen to meet him.
Your boyfriend?
No, the Doctor’s not like that.
Oh, right. Couple of guys like that play for us Lineen. I’ve got no problem with it, though.
What? No. I
Where is he, then?
He’s playing Naxy.
For which team?
The Gora?
Too bad.
Why?
I’m Lineen. If I see him today, I’ve got to eliminate him from the Game. But I promise to make it painless. I’ve got to go. Arena Hotel, 13" floor. If anyone gives you problems just mention my name.
Will that help?
It always works for me.
Some nights when I struggle, I tell myself, just keep on pushing through it. Do whatever you can to help us win. That’s what Naxy’s all about, lads. Winning! I'll see all of you after the match.
You mean, you’re not playing?
My day off. Don’t worry, you'll be fine. Just protect your weak side, and open up your cover.
My cover?
On your wand. Take the safety cover off. Here, there you go.
But, Sharz, that’s a blade.
I know. We call that bit the blade for just that reason. Wouldn’t be much good without it.
It’s razor sharp. The wands we used during practice were only wood.
Like you said, that was practice.
Mister Destry.
I just want him to watch. Seeing the carnage first-hand may convince his Lordship that the situation here is critical.
I can’t work like this.
You should probably go.
How? How can I walk away knowing that the fate of my world is in the hands of this imbecile?
I’m beginning to see how your planet got into its situation.
How dare you!
Gentlemen, please. We're here to stop a war, not start a new one. What now?
I’m sorry. I wasn’t sure anyone was in here. I’m looking for the Earth delegation.
So much for our secret arrival.
Barely a handful know who you are, let alone that you’re here.
Someone’s certainly clued her in. Who exactly is this young lady?
Darzil Carlisle?
What a coincidence. That’s my name.
Guards, in here. Quickly.
It really is you. The Doctor will be so pleased.
What did you say?
Take this girl to the prisons.
What? No, please.
A few days of solitary should teach her a lesson about trespassing.
I didn’t mean any harm.
Destry, wait.
Lord Carlisle, I insist.
I said wait. Did you just say, the Doctor?
Yes. He’s who brought me to Cray.
Do you know him, sir?
Of course not. Is he nearby?
He’s joining me after his Game.
Game? Don't tell me he’s playing Naxy.
He is. Is something the matter?
Naxy is why we're here.
But I thought you were here on Cray to end its civil war.
The Game is the war, my dear.
I don’t understand.
Every day thousands of athletes march into that arena to play Naxy. To the death.
And if your friend the Doctor is walking in there unaware of that, I can assure you he will not be walking out again.

CARLISLE: Nothing I do can bring those people back, which is why I prefer to focus on the future.
DESTRY: And what future do you see for us?
CARLISLE: You know, Mister Destry, I haven’t the foggiest.
HOLLIS: Yeah, I was thinking about it. We can definitely make that happen. Schedule the photoshoot. Yeah, I’m just walking there now. Oh! Watch it.
NYSSA: Excuse me.
HOLLIS: Nah, it’s okay. Yeah, look, mate. No, I just bumped into someone. Listen, I'll talk to you after the Game, yeah? We'll sort it out. Cheers. Lost?
NYSSA: I’m looking for an Earth man named Darzil Carlisle.
HOLLIS: Back there. Arena Hotel, 13" floor.
NYSSA: Thank you.
HOLLIS: Ah ah. That area’s off-limits.
NYSSA: But I need to find him. Please let go of my arm.
HOLLIS: What’s your name?
NYSSA: Nyssa.
HOLLIS: Don’t you recognise me, Nyssa?
NYSSA: Should I?
HOLLIS: Half the women on Cray would kill to spend five minutes with me.
NYSSA: I must belong to the other half. Ow! You’re hurting me.
HOLLIS: It’s all right. No one’s around. We can talk. No harm in talking, right?
SHARZ: Not bad, Doctor. You learn fast.
DOCTOR: Several planets have similar games. The stick looks like one used in an Earth Game called hockey.
SHARZ: You don’t say.
DOCTOR: You don’t care.
SHARZ: Not in the slightest.
DOCTOR: The way you use your stick is far more aggressive, though.
SHARZ: Wand.
DOCTOR: Pardon?
SHARZ: It’s a wand. Stop calling it a stick.
DOCTOR: Sharz?
SHARZ: Yeah?
DOCTOR: Why is Darzil Carlisle on Cray?
SHARZ: I told you.
DOCTOR: No, you didn’t. Oh!
SHARZ: You oughtn’t let your guard down, Doctor. (whistle blows) All right, lads. Go suit up. It’s bad form to keep our Lineen friends waiting for their beating.
DOCTOR: Lineen? Back at the pub you thought I was a Lineen.
SHARZ: Yep.
DOCTOR: And you nearly killed me.
SHARZ: Aren’t you glad you weren’t Lineen?
DOCTOR: You hate them that much?
SHARZ: Hey, I don’t hate them, Doc. I just love to win.
HOLLIS: You really don’t know who I am? Hollis Az, four time all-star?
NYSSA: No.
HOLLIS: You’ve never watched Naxy, then.
NYSSA: I’ve only just heard of it.
HOLLIS: Man, great for the ego you are.
NYSSA: Well, I
HOLLIS: (laughs) No, it’s kind of nice. Everybody knows me as er, I dunno, the sort of guy I don’t always want to be. You know what I’m saying?
NYSSA: Er, I think so.
HOLLIS: Good. Now explain it to me. So what do you want with that old Earth man. You’re too young and fine to be a bureaucrat.
NYSSA: My friend is very keen to meet him.
HOLLIS: Your boyfriend?
NYSSA: No, the Doctor’s not like that.
HOLLIS: Oh, right. Couple of guys like that play for us Lineen. I’ve got no problem with it, though.
NYSSA: What? No. I
HOLLIS: Where is he, then?
NYSSA: He’s playing Naxy.
HOLLIS: For which team?
NYSSA: The Gora?
HOLLIS: Too bad.
NYSSA: Why?
HOLLIS: I’m Lineen. If I see him today, I’ve got to eliminate him from the Game. But I promise to make it painless. I’ve got to go. Arena Hotel, 13" floor. If anyone gives you problems just mention my name.
NYSSA: Will that help?
HOLLIS: It always works for me.
SHARZ: Some nights when I struggle, I tell myself, just keep on pushing through it. Do whatever you can to help us win. That’s what Naxy’s all about, lads. Winning! I'll see all of you after the match.
DOCTOR: You mean, you’re not playing?
SHARZ: My day off. Don’t worry, you'll be fine. Just protect your weak side, and open up your cover.
DOCTOR: My cover?
SHARZ: On your wand. Take the safety cover off. Here, there you go.
DOCTOR: But, Sharz, that’s a blade.
SHARZ: I know. We call that bit the blade for just that reason. Wouldn’t be much good without it.
DOCTOR: It’s razor sharp. The wands we used during practice were only wood.
SHARZ: Like you said, that was practice.
FAYE: Mister Destry.
DESTRY: I just want him to watch. Seeing the carnage first-hand may convince his Lordship that the situation here is critical.
CARLISLE: I can’t work like this.
FAYE: You should probably go.
DESTRY: How? How can I walk away knowing that the fate of my world is in the hands of this imbecile?
CARLISLE: I’m beginning to see how your planet got into its situation.
DESTRY: How dare you!
FAYE: Gentlemen, please. We're here to stop a war, not start a new one. What now?
NYSSA: I’m sorry. I wasn’t sure anyone was in here. I’m looking for the Earth delegation.
FAYE: So much for our secret arrival.
DESTRY: Barely a handful know who you are, let alone that you’re here.
CARLISLE: Someone’s certainly clued her in. Who exactly is this young lady?
NYSSA: Darzil Carlisle?
CARLISLE: What a coincidence. That’s my name.
DESTRY: Guards, in here. Quickly.
NYSSA: It really is you. The Doctor will be so pleased.
CARLISLE: What did you say?
DESTRY: Take this girl to the prisons.
NYSSA: What? No, please.
DESTRY: A few days of solitary should teach her a lesson about trespassing.
NYSSA: I didn’t mean any harm.
CARLISLE: Destry, wait.
DESTRY: Lord Carlisle, I insist.
CARLISLE: I said wait. Did you just say, the Doctor?
NYSSA: Yes. He’s who brought me to Cray.
FAYE: Do you know him, sir?
CARLISLE: Of course not. Is he nearby?
NYSSA: He’s joining me after his Game.
CARLISLE: Game? Don't tell me he’s playing Naxy.
NYSSA: He is. Is something the matter?
FAYE: Naxy is why we're here.
NYSSA: But I thought you were here on Cray to end its civil war.
CARLISLE: The Game is the war, my dear.
NYSSA: I don’t understand.
FAYE: Every day thousands of athletes march into that arena to play Naxy. To the death.
DESTRY: And if your friend the Doctor is walking in there unaware of that, I can assure you he will not be walking out again.

elements.text: [Part Two]

Good afternoon, Naxy fans, and welcome to the match of the day, sponsored by Majestic Tyres, the Kings of the Road. Wherever you are, you’re happy to join us, because it’s a beautiful day for Naxy. I’m Garny Diblick, and I’m joined by Gora manager and player
And superstar.
And superstar, Sharz Sevix. How are you today, Sharz?
Very well, Garny, very well. Looking forward to another exciting Game of Naxy
Let’s get straight to what’s on every fan’s mind, though, the Gora’s recent rough patch.
Well, er no.
Six consecutive losing games?
Yeah, but
Your season record isn’t much better. The Gora are at 19931, the Lineen are at 37323. What else would you call it?
Okay, that’s a rough patch.
[OC]: Now the problems for the Gora as I see it
That man, Sharz. He’s the one who asked the Doctor to join the Gora.
He is something of a loose cannon.
You're being too kind, Ambassador. Sharz is a devolved, bullying clod.
I didn’t much care for him myself.
Destry, must these guards be breathing down our necks? This girl is obviously no threat.
Very well. Return to your posts but stay ready.
It doesn’t make sense. These games are televised to all of Cray?
They’re our most popular entertainment.
Then Naxy cannot be what you say.
Mister Destry sent recordings of matches to the UI. It’s a war, all right, only the players and fans refuse to see it as such.
But why would they let the Doctor play such a deadly Game? He’s not even from Cray.
There’s no rule against it. Most outsiders usually know better.
You all right, Doctor?
Hmm? Oh, er
The name’s Ockle Dirr. I'm Gora field skipper when Sharz is off.
Yes, hello. Those men across the pitch, they're Lineen?
Well done, Doctor. Sharz said you was a bright boy.
They’re armed with blades as well. Naxy is just people hacking one another for sport, isn’t it? Ockle, we have to get out of here.
(laughs) First Game jitters, eh? Oh, don’t worry. They never last long.
Whistle blows, crowd cheers.
Take ‘em, lads!
Clash of blades.
There’s the whistle, and today’s match is underway. The Gora are making straight for their foes.
Wand blades blazing in the sunlight. Beautiful.
And there’s the first elimination! That didn’t take long. I can’t quite see
It was Faveri .
Faveri. One of yours, then.
Yeah. Nice kid. Shame.
It’s horrible. So horrible.
Do you see the Doctor anywhere?
The Naxy pitch is massive.
All deaths are chronicled. You can always find him later.
Now that is a relief.
You call this entertainment?
Well, listen to the emotion in your own voice,. Naxy feeds my people’s passions.
Perhaps, what are you called, child?
Nyssa.
Perhaps, Nyssa, your friend is resourceful enough to survive.
Fifty thousand other players believed that this season. They're all dead now, of course.
Dead. Hacked to death.
Get back into formation.
Formation? This man has just been murdered.
Not murdered, eliminated, retired, and it’s up to us to show he didn’t drop in vain. Now get into formation!
So, Faveri is the first to be retired today. Mazus gets credit for that point. A few more eliminations to tell you about. Chalno, Beridvi and Steinex all retired here in the early going. All Gora.
Pity about Chalno. He had the potential to be a great striker.

Just a reminder we'll be looking out for a few milestones today. The Lineens own Hollis Az is only seven eliminations away from the century mark. That'll give him four straight hundred plus seasons. Quite impressive for such a young man, eh, Sharz?
He’s lucky.
He nearly used that luck against you yesterday.
I dunno what you’re talking about, Garny.
[OC]: Gambey was just eliminated there.
We have to do something!
We can do nothing until time expires.
How long will that be?
A Rev. Forty Earth minutes.
Mister Destry, you’re the Lineen coach. Surely your authority
If I stop this match, whatever authority I possess will be compromised.
But if you can stop it
No, he’s right, Nyssa. It would be a sign of weakness on his part. The peace process would be over
before it even began.
These things must be approached delicately.
Even if it costs the Doctor his life?
Stop! Naxy is not a sport! It’s barbaric slaughter! A war you cannot win!
Another player dies screaming.
You must stop doing this. You’re only killing yourselves. Keep back! Keep
We obliterated them that day. I can remember
Sorry to cut you off, skipper, but we have some action in the back field. One of your rookies is in the thick of it.
Oh right. Oh, that’s the Doctor.
The Doctor?
[OC]: He’s currently fighting off a series of vicious attacks from veteran Lineen striker Hab Zakis.
Is that your friend, Nyssa?
Yes. He’s in trouble.
I don’t know. He seems competent enough with a wand.
I will not be a party to this. Stay back!
We’re seeing some amazing wand work from the Doctor. Where have you blues been hiding him, Sharz?
He had a so-so pre-match session, but he’s a gamer, you can tell that by watching parry Zakis there.
Uh oh, he really has his hands full now. Tren Belok coming out to back up Zakis. Look out!
Gasps.
Doctor!
No, he’s all right.
Better than all right. He’s just knocked down two of my best players.
A leg kick, with a forearm sweep, and Belok and Zakis just went down!
The Doctor’s taunting them. What a gamer.
The Doctor is yelling something at his fallen rivals.
Just a little trash talk, Garny. He’s entitled, after that manoeuvre.
I’m sorry, but that was the only way I could see to stop you. Now please, we must end this Game.
Belok is grabbing his arm.
SHARzZ: Belok’s done. Look at him!
The Doctor is poised above them, ready to score his first and second eliminations.
Finish ‘em! Finish ‘em!
Something’s just happened on the pitch. The Doctor Doctor is running off!
What?
He’s running off, leaving behind a pair of stunned Lineen strikers.
[OC]: What the spez is that fool doing!
He’s running from the fight. He’s giving up.
The Doctor’s no killer.
At least he’s safe.
For the moment.
Will he be able to get away?
The arena gates are on a timer lock. There’s no way to exit until time expires.
This mad little Game of yours just keeps getting better and better. Nyssa, where are you going?
To the arena. I must find a way to help the Doctor.
It’s too dangerous.
But I can’t just stand here while that announcer cheerfully describes his death.
You'll never get near the pitch.
I found my way here, didn’t I?
Faye, you go. Maybe there is a way to get word down to the players.
What am I supposed to say?
I don’t know, but Nyssa’s right. We must at least try.
Yes. Yes, of course.
Ill go with you.
No, stay. I’ve got full clearance. You'll just slow me down.
It’s a waste of time, Ambassador.
It’s my time to waste, Mister Destry. Care to come watch me prove you wrong?
Very well.
Thank you, Lord Carlisle.
The least I could do. I only hope they’re not too late.
Ockle just finished off Belok.
Well, that’s something.
And Meri has eliminated Zakis. But as the Doctor’s coach you must be disappointed by what we saw transpire.
Absolutely. I'll be having a word with him later.

And that’s not your only problem, Sharz, because Lineen striker Layz has just dropped your old pal Nerleen with an excellent forearm dig coupled with a text book throat swipe. Still another drop for the Gora. It seems you're on your way to seven straight losses, Sharz.
It ain’t over till it’s over.
Well, that’s certainly true.
How did Cray become like this? How could these people turn such bloodshed into a Game?
It was the other way round, actually, according to Faye. Naxy was once an innocent enough team sport. The Game’s fans changed all that.
How?

Supporters of various Naxy teams used to meet outside the arenas to fight before the matches. Vicious, deadly brawls they were. The people of Cray gradually shifted their interest from what happened on the pitch to the violence outside. Naxy evolved into a lethal combination of the two.
And no one tried to stop it?
No one wanted to. The Game is everything to these people. They never want to give up playing it.
Until the other team is wiped out.
Mmm. Sad, really. But then, what war isn’t? Now then, you said the Doctor wanted to see me.
Yes.
Well, I should like to see him.
He’ll be so pleased. He’s a great fan of yours.
What?
He goes on and on about your brilliance at negotiating peace. He couldn’t wait to meet you.
Meet me?
Yes. What’s the matter? You’ve gone pale.
Excuse me.
Lord Carlisle?
I, I’m sorry. I must deal with an urgent matter.
But the Doctor is
Door closes.
What are you playing at, Doctor?
I refuse to take part in this.
We are out here to play.
Ockle, at this rate most of us won't survive to ever play again.

You'd best get it together, mate. Those Lineen you tumbled nearly got away without a scratch. You let us down again and it won’t be the Lineen you'll have to worry about. Accidents can happen, Doctor.

The relative calm of the last quarter Rev as the Gora and Lineen regroup. Let’s take you to the east atrium, where the action appears to be heating up again. Apparently Hollis Az has his first elimination of the day.
Took him long enough.
Hollis has retired Suzikx with a brilliant backslash to the chest.
Only six away now, isn’t he?
That’s right. We’re counting down to Hollis’s one hundredth score of the season. He’s number two in the league there.
After yours truly.
You’ve accrued 133 eliminations in how many games this season, Sharz?
Twelve, thirteen?
Outstanding.
Thanks, Garny.
Back to the action on the pitch. The Lineen are swarming. The Gora are on the defensive yet again.
Doctor, watch the rear. Watch the oh!
Ockle! There’s too many of them. We’re being massacred. Gora players, listen to me! We might still escape this madness! I have a plan! You must follow me.
Oh, now what’s he up to?
In the backfield, Ockle’s been eliminated. Meanwhile, the Doctor is fairly animated about something.
I can’t look any more.
He’s shouting at his team mates. Whatever he’s saying, it's working. The Gora are following him.

He’s leading them away. Lord Carlisle? The Doctor’s getting them to stop fighting. Lord Carlisle, I oh. Sir, I’ve spilled your papers. I wanted to tell you that. Oh, conditions for covertly extending hostilities. Rendezvous at Terrace Diva, Arena Bells.
What’s happening? I heard shouting.
Some, some of your papers fell.
Just leave them for Faye. Is the Doctor all right?
The Gora have begun following him. I think they're trying to get away.
Over there. The left flank is open. If we all head for this western gate we may be able to break through. Come on! This way.
Gora rookie the Doctor is leading his team mates in an apparent attempt to flee Lineen strikers.
This is a sickening display, Garny. Cowardice on this scale is
Lineen look as surprised as we are. The Gora are near the western gates.
Look, isn’t that Pakle? It is Pakle! Look at him go!
Gora striker Emin Pakle, followed by Jareth, Dai and Findus, have
Attaboy, Pakle!
They’ve just pushed themselves back around and behind the Lineen strikers. They’ve caught the Lineen flat-footed!
Oh, there goes Chollop.
Pakle has eliminated Chollop. Dozens more Lineen are dropping in an instant. The Doctor’s actions now looking more and more like a brilliant strategic tactic.
Yes.
No! I meant for us to escape. You must stop this.
[OC]: We see the Doctor there, apparently giving off a battle cry.
It isn’t a battle cry, it’s rage. People are dying all around him.
At least he’s out of danger again.
The Doctor would rather forfeit his own life than cause the deaths of all those people.
This way, Ambassador. If we can get closer, I can shout new orders to my players.
What’s gotten the crowd so excited?
The Rev is almost over. They must be excited about
Wait, isn’t that him over there?
Who?
The Doctor. I can see him. Doctor! Doctor! No, it’s no good, he can’t hear me. We have to move closer.
No.
Destry, come on.
Something’s wrong. Something is very wrong.
What?
Those retired players are all Lineen.
Where are you going? We have to go this way.
I must see what’s happening.
Destry, we’re supposed to be helping the Doctor.
Never mind the Doctor, my players need me. Stay on the offence! Take the battle to the enemy!
So much for our patron of peace. Doctor!
Eight, possibly nine dozen Lineen strikers have retired in a very short amount of time. Our statistician is trying to get the names of all players involved.
Ha ha! This is unprecedented.
One surprising footnote. The Doctor has yet to score a single point.
Doesn’t matter. That manoeuvre he masterminded has completely changed the configuration of the Game.
163, I’m told. 163 Lineen were retired in just that last sweep. I see Friston and Mers.
Ockle in a power touch. Pakle to Car Partas! Who saw that coming?
Certainly not Partas. There’s the buzzer, and the wands all lower in unison. Quite a match, eh, Sharz?
Oh, sorry, I’m busted. That was, that was amazing!
A few Gora supporters would disagree with you. We'll be back with a wrap-up and a chat with today’s star of the Game right after this message from Majestic Tyres.
You were meant to follow me out of the arena. This wasn’t what I intended.
Doctor! Doctor!
Sharz.
I thought you were great. Oi. Oh, ow! Hey, back off, Doc. Game’s over, all right?
You deceived me, Sharz. You nearly got me killed!
It all worked out in the end.
Worked out? Hundreds of people have just been slaughtered!
SHARzZ: And thanks to you, most of them were Lineen. Come, meet Garny Diblick. He’s here to interview you.
A pleasure, Doctor. Great Game.
What?
Okay, stand by. We’re back in five, four, three.

Welcome back. We’re live on the pitch with the Gora’s newest superstar, the Doctor. Incredible result today, Doctor. Your redirection of the Gora strikers was the turning point of the match, perhaps the season. What inspired that tactical masterstroke?
A bloodbath, Garny. Naxy is not a sport, it’s sanctioned genocide. To allow it to continue one more mmmph!

He’s a bit wound up, Garny. I'll field this one for him. This was just one of those days where a superior athlete was on top of his Game. The Doctor had tremendous rhythm out there. His focus, his concentration, his wand, everything was as good as it could be.
The people of Cray are victims of a
Er, sorry to cut you off, Doctor, but we understand Hollis Az is talking with reporters in the press room. Let’s take you there now.
[OC]: It was that kind of Game. We knew where we messed up and how they capitalised on it. We failed to execute and they had a bigger expert than we did. No further questions.

So a down-beat Hollis proceeds to lick his wounds after a day which saw the Gora obliterate the Lineen. Getting his hundredth elimination of the season on a day like today is obviously a bitter sweet experience. With that, we'll end today’s Naxy coverage. We invite you millions of fans to join us again tomorrow for another exciting match. For Sharz Sevix, this is Garny Diblick wishing you a good Naxy night.
We're clear.
You won't get away with this, Sharz. This Game cannot continue.
Oh, I dunno about that. You know that Darzil Carlisle fellow you mentioned back at the pub? That negotiator?
What about him?
Me and Destry will be meeting with him tomorrow. They’re calling them peace talks or something.
Yes, because their intention is to end the war which you call Naxy.
Right. Funny thing is, the Game’s gotten a bit sticky for us Gora lately. Embarrassed to say I was even considering calling it a day while I still had something to show for it.
But?
Well, it’s obvious, innit? The Gora have new life thanks to you.
I was trying to prevent those deaths.
Well, like it or not, Doctor, you’re the new golden boy of Naxy. And I ain’t stopping this Game until every single Lineen striker is retired. We're gonna end it all. Total elimination.

SHARZ: Oh right. Oh, that’s the Doctor.
NYSSA: The Doctor?
GARNEY: [OC]: He’s currently fighting off a series of vicious attacks from veteran Lineen striker Hab Zakis.
FAYE: Is that your friend, Nyssa?
NYSSA: Yes. He’s in trouble.
DESTRY: I don’t know. He seems competent enough with a wand.
DOCTOR: I will not be a party to this. Stay back!
GARNY: We’re seeing some amazing wand work from the Doctor. Where have you blues been hiding him, Sharz?
SHARZ: He had a so-so pre-match session, but he’s a gamer, you can tell that by watching parry Zakis there.
GARNY: Uh oh, he really has his hands full now. Tren Belok coming out to back up Zakis. Look out!
NYSSA: Doctor!
CARLISLE: No, he’s all right.
DESTRY: Better than all right. He’s just knocked down two of my best players.
GARNY: A leg kick, with a forearm sweep, and Belok and Zakis just went down!
SHARZ: The Doctor’s taunting them. What a gamer.
GARNY: The Doctor is yelling something at his fallen rivals.
SHARZ: Just a little trash talk, Garny. He’s entitled, after that manoeuvre.
DOCTOR: I’m sorry, but that was the only way I could see to stop you. Now please, we must end this Game.
GARNY: Belok is grabbing his arm.
GARNY: SHARzZ: Belok’s done. Look at him!
GARNY: The Doctor is poised above them, ready to score his first and second eliminations.
SHARZ.: Finish ‘em! Finish ‘em!
GARNY: Something’s just happened on the pitch. The Doctor Doctor is running off!
SHARZ: What?
GARNY: He’s running off, leaving behind a pair of stunned Lineen strikers.
SHARZ: [OC]: What the spez is that fool doing!
DESTRY: He’s running from the fight. He’s giving up.
NYSSA: The Doctor’s no killer.
FAYE: At least he’s safe.
DESTRY: For the moment.
NYSSA: Will he be able to get away?
DESTRY: The arena gates are on a timer lock. There’s no way to exit until time expires.
CARLISLE: This mad little Game of yours just keeps getting better and better. Nyssa, where are you going?
NYSSA: To the arena. I must find a way to help the Doctor.
FAYE: It’s too dangerous.
NYSSA: But I can’t just stand here while that announcer cheerfully describes his death.
DESTRY: You'll never get near the pitch.
NYSSA: I found my way here, didn’t I?
CARLISLE: Faye, you go. Maybe there is a way to get word down to the players.
FAYE: What am I supposed to say?
CARLISLE: I don’t know, but Nyssa’s right. We must at least try.
FAYE: Yes. Yes, of course.
NYSSA: Ill go with you.
FAYE: No, stay. I’ve got full clearance. You'll just slow me down.
DESTRY: It’s a waste of time, Ambassador.
FAYE: It’s my time to waste, Mister Destry. Care to come watch me prove you wrong?
DESTRY: Very well.
NYSSA: Thank you, Lord Carlisle.
CARLISLE: The least I could do. I only hope they’re not too late.
GARNY: Ockle just finished off Belok.
SHARZ: Well, that’s something.
GARNY: And Meri has eliminated Zakis. But as the Doctor’s coach you must be disappointed by what we saw transpire.
SHARZ: Absolutely. I'll be having a word with him later.
GARNY: And that’s not your only problem, Sharz, because Lineen striker Layz has just dropped your old pal Nerleen with an excellent forearm dig coupled with a text book throat swipe. Still another drop for the Gora. It seems you're on your way to seven straight losses, Sharz.
SHARZ: It ain’t over till it’s over.
GARNY: Well, that’s certainly true.
NYSSA: How did Cray become like this? How could these people turn such bloodshed into a Game?
CARLISLE: It was the other way round, actually, according to Faye. Naxy was once an innocent enough team sport. The Game’s fans changed all that.
NYSSA: How?
CARLISLE: Supporters of various Naxy teams used to meet outside the arenas to fight before the matches. Vicious, deadly brawls they were. The people of Cray gradually shifted their interest from what happened on the pitch to the violence outside. Naxy evolved into a lethal combination of the two.
NYSSA: And no one tried to stop it?
CARLISLE: No one wanted to. The Game is everything to these people. They never want to give up playing it.
NYSSA: Until the other team is wiped out.
CARLISLE: Mmm. Sad, really. But then, what war isn’t? Now then, you said the Doctor wanted to see me.
NYSSA: Yes.
CARLISLE: Well, I should like to see him.
NYSSA: He’ll be so pleased. He’s a great fan of yours.
CARLISLE: What?
NYSSA: He goes on and on about your brilliance at negotiating peace. He couldn’t wait to meet you.
CARLISLE: Meet me?
NYSSA: Yes. What’s the matter? You’ve gone pale.
CARLISLE: Excuse me.
NYSSA: Lord Carlisle?
CARLISLE: I, I’m sorry. I must deal with an urgent matter.
NYSSA: But the Doctor is
OCKLE: What are you playing at, Doctor?
DOCTOR: I refuse to take part in this.
OCKLE: We are out here to play.
DOCTOR: Ockle, at this rate most of us won't survive to ever play again.
OCKLE: You'd best get it together, mate. Those Lineen you tumbled nearly got away without a scratch. You let us down again and it won’t be the Lineen you'll have to worry about. Accidents can happen, Doctor.
GARNY: The relative calm of the last quarter Rev as the Gora and Lineen regroup. Let’s take you to the east atrium, where the action appears to be heating up again. Apparently Hollis Az has his first elimination of the day.
SHARZ: Took him long enough.
GARNY: Hollis has retired Suzikx with a brilliant backslash to the chest.
SHARZ: Only six away now, isn’t he?
GARNY: That’s right. We’re counting down to Hollis’s one hundredth score of the season. He’s number two in the league there.
SHARZ: After yours truly.
GARNY: You’ve accrued 133 eliminations in how many games this season, Sharz?
SHARZ: Twelve, thirteen?
GARNY: Outstanding.
SHARZ: Thanks, Garny.
GARNY: Back to the action on the pitch. The Lineen are swarming. The Gora are on the defensive yet again.
OCKLE: Doctor, watch the rear. Watch the oh!
DOCTOR: Ockle! There’s too many of them. We’re being massacred. Gora players, listen to me! We might still escape this madness! I have a plan! You must follow me.
SHARZ: Oh, now what’s he up to?
GARNY: In the backfield, Ockle’s been eliminated. Meanwhile, the Doctor is fairly animated about something.
SHARZ: I can’t look any more.
GARNY: He’s shouting at his team mates. Whatever he’s saying, it's working. The Gora are following him.
NYSSA: He’s leading them away. Lord Carlisle? The Doctor’s getting them to stop fighting. Lord Carlisle, I oh. Sir, I’ve spilled your papers. I wanted to tell you that. Oh, conditions for covertly extending hostilities. Rendezvous at Terrace Diva, Arena Bells.
CARLISLE: What’s happening? I heard shouting.
NYSSA: Some, some of your papers fell.
CARLISLE: Just leave them for Faye. Is the Doctor all right?
NYSSA: The Gora have begun following him. I think they're trying to get away.
DOCTOR: Over there. The left flank is open. If we all head for this western gate we may be able to break through. Come on! This way.
GARNY: Gora rookie the Doctor is leading his team mates in an apparent attempt to flee Lineen strikers.
SHARZ: This is a sickening display, Garny. Cowardice on this scale is
GARNY: Lineen look as surprised as we are. The Gora are near the western gates.
SHARZ: Look, isn’t that Pakle? It is Pakle! Look at him go!
GARNY: Gora striker Emin Pakle, followed by Jareth, Dai and Findus, have
SHARZ: Attaboy, Pakle!
GARNY: They’ve just pushed themselves back around and behind the Lineen strikers. They’ve caught the Lineen flat-footed!
SHARZ: Oh, there goes Chollop.
GARNY: Pakle has eliminated Chollop. Dozens more Lineen are dropping in an instant. The Doctor’s actions now looking more and more like a brilliant strategic tactic.
SHARZ: Yes.
DOCTOR: No! I meant for us to escape. You must stop this.
GARNY: [OC]: We see the Doctor there, apparently giving off a battle cry.
NYSSA: It isn’t a battle cry, it’s rage. People are dying all around him.
CARLISLE: At least he’s out of danger again.
NYSSA: The Doctor would rather forfeit his own life than cause the deaths of all those people.
DESTRY: This way, Ambassador. If we can get closer, I can shout new orders to my players.
FAYE: What’s gotten the crowd so excited?
DESTRY: The Rev is almost over. They must be excited about
FAYE: Wait, isn’t that him over there?
DESTRY: Who?
FAYE: The Doctor. I can see him. Doctor! Doctor! No, it’s no good, he can’t hear me. We have to move closer.
DESTRY: No.
FAYE: Destry, come on.
DESTRY: Something’s wrong. Something is very wrong.
FAYE: What?
DESTRY: Those retired players are all Lineen.
FAYE: Where are you going? We have to go this way.
DESTRY: I must see what’s happening.
FAYE: Destry, we’re supposed to be helping the Doctor.
DESTRY: Never mind the Doctor, my players need me. Stay on the offence! Take the battle to the enemy!
FAYE: So much for our patron of peace. Doctor!
GARNY: Eight, possibly nine dozen Lineen strikers have retired in a very short amount of time. Our statistician is trying to get the names of all players involved.
SHARZ: Ha ha! This is unprecedented.
GARNY: One surprising footnote. The Doctor has yet to score a single point.
SHARZ: Doesn’t matter. That manoeuvre he masterminded has completely changed the configuration of the Game.
GARNY: 163, I’m told. 163 Lineen were retired in just that last sweep. I see Friston and Mers.
SHARZ: Ockle in a power touch. Pakle to Car Partas! Who saw that coming?
GARNY: Certainly not Partas. There’s the buzzer, and the wands all lower in unison. Quite a match, eh, Sharz?
SHARZ: Oh, sorry, I’m busted. That was, that was amazing!
GARNY: A few Gora supporters would disagree with you. We'll be back with a wrap-up and a chat with today’s star of the Game right after this message from Majestic Tyres.
DOCTOR: You were meant to follow me out of the arena. This wasn’t what I intended.
SHARZ: Doctor! Doctor!
DOCTOR: Sharz.
SHARZ: I thought you were great. Oi. Oh, ow! Hey, back off, Doc. Game’s over, all right?
DOCTOR: You deceived me, Sharz. You nearly got me killed!
SHARZ: It all worked out in the end.
DOCTOR: Worked out? Hundreds of people have just been slaughtered!
DOCTOR: SHARzZ: And thanks to you, most of them were Lineen. Come, meet Garny Diblick. He’s here to interview you.
GARNY: A pleasure, Doctor. Great Game.
DOCTOR: What?
TECH: Okay, stand by. We’re back in five, four, three.
GARNY: Welcome back. We’re live on the pitch with the Gora’s newest superstar, the Doctor. Incredible result today, Doctor. Your redirection of the Gora strikers was the turning point of the match, perhaps the season. What inspired that tactical masterstroke?
DOCTOR: A bloodbath, Garny. Naxy is not a sport, it’s sanctioned genocide. To allow it to continue one more mmmph!
SHARZ: He’s a bit wound up, Garny. I'll field this one for him. This was just one of those days where a superior athlete was on top of his Game. The Doctor had tremendous rhythm out there. His focus, his concentration, his wand, everything was as good as it could be.
DOCTOR: The people of Cray are victims of a
GARNY: Er, sorry to cut you off, Doctor, but we understand Hollis Az is talking with reporters in the press room. Let’s take you there now.
HOLLIS: [OC]: It was that kind of Game. We knew where we messed up and how they capitalised on it. We failed to execute and they had a bigger expert than we did. No further questions.
GARNY: So a down-beat Hollis proceeds to lick his wounds after a day which saw the Gora obliterate the Lineen. Getting his hundredth elimination of the season on a day like today is obviously a bitter sweet experience. With that, we'll end today’s Naxy coverage. We invite you millions of fans to join us again tomorrow for another exciting match. For Sharz Sevix, this is Garny Diblick wishing you a good Naxy night.
TECH: We're clear.
DOCTOR: You won't get away with this, Sharz. This Game cannot continue.
SHARZ: Oh, I dunno about that. You know that Darzil Carlisle fellow you mentioned back at the pub? That negotiator?
DOCTOR: What about him?
SHARZ: Me and Destry will be meeting with him tomorrow. They’re calling them peace talks or something.
DOCTOR: Yes, because their intention is to end the war which you call Naxy.
SHARZ: Right. Funny thing is, the Game’s gotten a bit sticky for us Gora lately. Embarrassed to say I was even considering calling it a day while I still had something to show for it.
DOCTOR: But?
SHARZ: Well, it’s obvious, innit? The Gora have new life thanks to you.
DOCTOR: I was trying to prevent those deaths.
SHARZ: Well, like it or not, Doctor, you’re the new golden boy of Naxy. And I ain’t stopping this Game until every single Lineen striker is retired. We're gonna end it all. Total elimination.

elements.text: [Part Three]
They’ve turned the Doctor into some kind of hero.
He’s alive. That’s something, I suppose.
Try not to sound so pleased.
Well, he hasn’t exactly improved the chances for peace, has he.
I'd better go and find him.
I'll come too.
Er, what about the peace talks?
What about them?
Shouldn’t you prepare for them?
Well, I imagine I could.
Lord Carlisle.
Mmm?
Those papers I knocked over. They were yours, weren’t they?
Yes. Why?
Well, one of them
Door bursts open.
Faye.
Faye, what is it? What’s wrong?
(crying) Those Naxy players, the violence. I couldn’t believe. I couldn’t believe.
But you’ve seen the recordings of the games.
It didn’t seem as real on television.
Faye, did you find the Doctor?
We'd got right down to the pitch, when Destry just ran off. It was then that I noticed the bodies. The blood was everywhere.
I know, I know. Lord Carlisle.
I'll look after her. You go and check on the Doctor.
Thank you.
Lots of chatter.
Come on, lads. It’s all good. We'll get ‘em back tomorrow. The Gora’ll come out all cocky and that’s when my blade gets thirsty. Whack! Thwack! Wait and see.
Hollis.
Hey, yeah, Coach.
My office. Now.
Coach, I just want to say
How dare you! (thump) You let that amateur, the Doctor, make fools of us.
He... we had an off day, Mister Destry, that’s all.
How many strikers did we loose today?
I don’t know. Couple of hundred.
Four hundred. Zakis, Belok, many of our best gone like that.
But we're still way up for the year.
Not for long at this rate.
I'll get them back next Game.
Yes, you will. Beginning with the Doctor. You’re going to make sure his Naxy career ends as quickly as it began.
Doctor!
I told you, I will not sign any autographs. I... Nyssa.
I’m so relieved you're all right.
Yes, well, so am I.
What’s this about autographs?
The Gora faithful seem to have made me their new Naxy superstar.
I was so frightened for you. I told Lord Carlisle that
Lord Carlisle?
Yes.
You’ve met him?
I have.
Well, what’s he like? Did you get a picture?
Doctor!
Nyssa.
He’s very... nice. And I did not get a picture.
How close did you get?
As close as I am to you now.
How did you ever manage to do
He was in a private meeting when I accidentally sort of barged in.
You barged in on
I was lost.
Nyssa.
Doctor.
I said be discreet.
Well, you should talk.
Yes, fair point. Come on.
Where?
The Tardis. I need to wash off this face paint. The negotiation’s tomorrow and I can’t very well meet Darzil Carlisle looking like this.
I won't do it.
You have no choice, Hollis.
I don’t care. I ain’t wasting my one-on-one challenge on him.
The Doctor is a threat. He must be eliminated.
But Coach!

The Gora are desperate. Their dying regime views this as the moment to strike, thinking that we’re vulnerable. They’re wrong. Hollis, the Doctor cannot be allowed to encourage our enemy. Eliminating him is an honourable thing to do.
But what about Sharz?
What about him?
Sharz eliminated my father, my brother Milz.
Yes, I know. And deep down you think he’ll eliminate you too.
Let me use my one-on-one challenge against him, and I'll show you who does the eliminating.
Yes, very impressive. Still, you may get your wish.
What do you mean?
If we’re lucky, there may not even be a one-on-one challenge tomorrow. You remember Darzil Carlisle?
Who? That old Earth man? Sure.
He is a peace negotiator. He came to Cray to end Naxy.
What!
I’m only telling you because, as my star striker, you are to attend the peace talks with me.
But, end the Game? We're so close to winning.
It’s for the good of our entire world. If Sharz accepts my terms, your challenge to the Doctor can be dismissed. But if the talks fail, if the Game goes on, you have no choice but to eliminate him.
Leave Cray.
Yes.
Why?
It’s too dangerous.
But don’t you want to see how Lord Carlisle ends the war? What's wrong? You're hiding something from me, aren’t you?
I found this in Lord Carlisle’s quarters.
Some sort of balance sheet. So?
Read the back. His name isn’t on it, but
Prolong hostilities in the Cray Naxy conflict. Where was this?
Mixed in with his papers.
You're positive they were his?
Don’t you believe me?
Nyssa, this man is the greatest force for peace
In the cosmos. So you keep telling me. But you’ve never met him, have you. I think he was friendly enough, but, well, what if he’s not who you think he is?
This note could just be something he’s investigating.
It’s from a private channel, authorised to Darzil Carlisle. And what about the rendezvous point.
Terrace Diva, Arena Bells. Very well, then.
What are you doing?
Seeing if the Tardis has picked up any unusual transmissions. Cray is a fairly isolated planet so it shouldn't take long to find out if
Anything?
No. No trace of a signal to anywhere off-planet. Wait a moment.
What is it?
It may be a common link signal to a nearby satellite.
Common link? That’s to anyone who wants to pick it up, right?
Yes. Nothing suspicious about that, but there’s a shadow signal sort of hiding underneath it.
Is that possible?
Well, as I’m looking right at it, I would tend to think so.
Who’s sending it?
I can’t be sure, but it’s bouncing down to another location on Cray.
Where?
Where? Yes, well, judging by these rough coordinates from the Tardis maps, it’s a place the locals refer to as Arena Bells.
Arena Bells.
Get some sleep, Nyssa. Tomorrow morning we're paying a visit to Lord Carlisle.
Privacy channel four. Carlisle, 10028. Yes, it’s me. The situation here is... So you say. But I still don’t like it. I can’t afford any disappointments. I want to know everything you intend to do.
Tardis door opens.
Shall I bring your camera?
No. Best not this time.
Tardis door closes.
What are you going to say to him?
Apart from hello? Not entirely sure.
Nyssa.
Faye.
I thought that was you. Hello.
Hello. You’re feeling better then.
Much better, thanks. If anything, what I saw yesterday made me even more determined to end Naxy.
The Doctor clears his throat.
Oh, sorry, Doctor. This is Ambassador Faye Davis.
Pleasure to meet you, Ambassador.
Likewise. So is this blue box your spacecraft?
On good days.
Pardon?
Ignore Nyssa’s pedestrian comedy. How did you find us?

Sharz. He and I were just reviewing the protocol for this afternoon’s talks. He said he first met you at a pub around the corner, so I decided to have a wander and look for you. Didn’t think I’d actually find you though.
It would seem unlikely.
Oh, before I forget, Doctor. Coach Destry wants to see you.
Destry? He’s the one trying to end the Game?
Right. I was about to go meet with him. You can join me if you like.
Won’t Sharz mind the Doctor conferring with a rival coach?
Doubt it. It was Sharz who told me Destry wanted to see him.
Perhaps you should go with Faye while I talk to Lord Carlisle on my own.
What? No, I don’t think I
Look, you can always join me later.
Very well. I’ve waited this long. What’s a few more hours? Lead on, Ambassador.
Hubbub of voices.
[OC]: Should be an exciting Game tonight. Earlier today I had a chance to speak with Lineen coach Bela Destry, after last night’s devastating loss.

[OC]: This setback only makes our task clearer. The Lineen have many advantages in this Game of Naxy. We have resolute players, we are vigilant, and we know our honour must be defended. Our team is focussed and unwavering. We've an effective plan of battle and the flexibility to meet every challenge.
Switch it off, Feeb.
[OC]: Nothing, nothing will divert us from our clear and
Switch it off or I'll switch it off with my fist!
[OC]: And we will prevail.
We'll see who prevails, Mister Destry. The Gora may be down, but you'll soon see we ain’t out.
We're on Arena Bells.
Right now?
It surrounds the whole Naxy pitch.
I see.
Bells is the Cray word for surrounding road. Arena Bells is massive, but it’s usually pretty dead unless
there’s a Game on.
This is your first visit to Cray?
Yes. Why?
You seem remarkably well-informed.
Well, it’s not too hard to grasp the basics. Because of its geology, Cray only has one major city. The virtual tours are a big help too.
And what do the virtual tours say about a place called Terrace Diva.
I don’t (faints)
Faye? Faye!
Knock on door, door opens and closes. A tinkling version of Holst’s Jupiter is playing.
Lord Carlisle? Sir?
Oh, what now?
You have a visitor.
Oh. Nyssa. Er, sorry. One moment.
Music turned off.
Preparing for the negotiations?

Er, yes. On a break. Butler, some tea for our guest. Some tea! My robot butler. I have to shout. The thing’s gone deaf in one sensor. I’ve tried to have it repaired, but er... So, to what do I owe this visit?
A simple question. What do you know of Terrace Diva at Arena Bells?
Are you feeling better?
Just a bit woozy. I’ve been fighting off some kind of virus ever since I got here.
Your eyes.
What about them?
They're blood-shot.
It’s probably just an allergy.
You should rest.
No, I’m fine. Let’s get going.
Perhaps you’re overworked. The stress must be
I said I’m fine.
Very well. Hmm.
What?
This coin. It was on the ground there.
Are you that hard up for cash?
It’s from the Bank of Galtry.
Galtry? Galtry is on the other side of the galaxy.
Well, the galaxy has many sides, but your meaning is clear. Why would it be on a Cray pavement?
Doctor, Destry’s waiting.
That’s another thing. Why is Coach Destry so determined to end the Game?
Death’s not a good enough reason?
According to Sharz, the Lineen are on the verge of winning the Game outright.
Doctor, the Game is a war.
I know, but think about it. The Gora are on the brink of total elimination. Why should Desitry end Naxy when he’s so close to victory?
I don’t know.
Neither do I. Let’s go and see if we can’t find out.
So you’ve never heard of Arena Bells?
Afraid not. Is it important?
It may be. Or it may be nothing.
Sorry I couldn’t be more helpful.
No, it’s fine. I’m rather relieved, actually.
Well, I should get back to work.
Yes. Lord Carlisle?
Hmm?
What makes you do it?
Do what?
Bring peace to so many places.
Oh, well, I don’t know. It just sort of happens.
The Doctor says you’ve saved billions of lives.
Yes, and he would know, wouldn’t he. Although according to you, the Doctor’s never met me.
Of course not.
Twaddle.
What?
That’s twaddle.
What's twaddle?
Whatever twaddle is, that’s it.
Are you saying you’ve heard of the Doctor before?
Heard of him? He’s my best friend.
Do you smoke, Doctor?
Never.
Pity. (lights up) I'll get right to it. We want your approval of the new Doctor Naxy boot. We’ve got several patterns which Marketing has been sitting on. I think the best of them is probably
I’m sorry.
About what?
What does this have to do with me?
What, didn’t Sharz explain how this works?
How what works?

The Balance Statute. Each team handles the other’s marketing and promotions. Take Hollis. Anything with his face on it is selling like mad right now, but every penny made from selling Hollis boots, Hollis shirts and Hollis posters goes to the Gora. The reverse is true for us.
You mean you’re actually marketing the enemy? Why would you do that?

To keep the Game competitive. The team which loses on the field gets the resources to invest in better equipment, more sophisticated training machinery. Eventually the losing team becomes the winning team and the pattern reverses.
So the Game need never end.

Precisely. But with all our Lineen victories we’ve been lacking financially these past few seasons, and that’s why when a Gora like you pops up, we have to exploit him to the fullest. I’m grateful to finally sell something which doesn’t have Sharz’s ugly face on it.
I’m afraid I won’t be participating in any marketing schemes. Your little death machine is running fine without my help, thank you.
Please yourself. You'll earn us money whether you cooperate or not.
You are merchandising his image to promote slaughter and death.
Our system is designed to keep the Game honest, Ambassador.
Yes, because honest annihilation is far preferable to the dishonest kind.
I am one of the few people working to change the system, Doctor, but the only way I can do it is from within. I suggest you join me. Now, about that Naxy boot.
I’m a fraud. My reputation is a sham, it’s a ruse, a deceit. Oh, I’m running out of synonyms. Did I already say fraud?
Lord Carlisle, calm down. Start at the beginning.
I don’t actually do what I’ve been doing for the past fifty years..
All right. Start before the beginning.
Nyssa, it isn’t Darzil Carlisle who is the greatest force for peace in the cosmos, it’s the Doctor.
But he’s never met you.
He has, only, only his past is my future. Er, wait, no, other way round. Yes. No. Yes.
Lord Carlisle.
The Doctor is my secret peace weapon. Every negotiation I ever negotiated, he negotiated. Well, apart from Zarek Four.
What happened on Zarek Four?
Oh, it’s not important. The point is, without his help I’ll never end the war on Cray.
But he came here to see you end the war.
Well then, we’re doomed, aren’t we.
But after all those negotiations you must have learned something?
The Doctor did everything. At one negotiation I only showed up for about two minutes in total. He made me take all the credit, of course.
But why would he ever do that?

I don’t know. He never told me. I’m nothing special, Nyssa. All I ever really wanted to do was to be a musician, and I was. And a good one, too. Until the Doctor came along and turned me into some icon for peace. Oh, don’t get me wrong, I adore him. He’s looked after me again and again. But he’s made a ruddy great mess of my life.
You’re respected and admired throughout the cosmos.
That’s what I mean. A mess.
Knock on door, door opens.
Yes?
We’re here to escort Lord Carlisle to the conference hall.
Blast. Nyssa, make sure the Doctor attends the conference.
I will.
And you'll be there as well?
Of course. I just need to locate this Terrace Diva place first.
Well, don’t take too long. Wish me luck. I really shall need it.
We're just curious, that’s all.
If you must know, my desire to end the bloodshed has recently overtaken my desire to win.
Which is very noble of you, but the illogical question is, why now?
If you’re quite through, Doctor.
Destry.
Knock on door.
Come.
Ah, Doctor. Thought you might still be here. I thought we might head over to the peace talks together, seeing as how you’re my Lieutenant.
Your what?

Each Coach is bringing one superstar to represent them at the table. Destry chose Hollis, I chose you. So this way you and Hollis can get all worked up at the peace talks, then right after you can go and play your one-on-one Game.
What one-on-one Game? Why does everyone on this planet speak so cryptically?
It was all over the news this morning. Hollis Az, the Lineen’s number one striker, has selected you for his one-on-one Naxy Game.
Oh, I see. And this Game is to the death, presumably?
It’s a single elimination contest, yes.
Then I refuse.
Well, if you refuse, Naxy rules state that thirty Gora strikers are to be eliminated in your place. You'll then be executed and buried without a grave, without honour.
Are there any laws on this planet which favour the innocent?

It may comfort you both to know that the Doctor’s one-on-one would replace our normal Naxy Game, so by accepting Hollis’s challenge, Doctor, several hundred more lives would be spared. Of course, the choice is entirely up to you.
It seems I have no choice at all.
Attaboy! Hey, for this Game, let’s get that cute little friend of yours to be a cheerleader.
Her name is Nyssa, Sharz. And by now she’s probably at a place called Terrace Diva on Arena Bells.
Terrace Diva?
Yes.
Was she on her own?
Most likely. Why do you ask?
There have been several murders in that district in recent days.
More like several thousand.
No, these weren’t Naxy related. It was an unknown assailant. Each victim had their neck snapped.
Then Nyssa may be in great danger. Come on.

Hello? Hello? Can anyone hear me? This must be the place. I triple-checked those coordinates. But there’s nothing here but miles and miles of concrete walls. Is someone there? I only wanted to ask you a few questions about... I'm sorry if I disturbed you. I’m
Snarl.
Wait. Stay back. Stay!
Roar, scream!

parts.searchable_dialogue:
NYSSA: They’ve turned the Doctor into some kind of hero.
CARLISLE: He’s alive. That’s something, I suppose.
NYSSA: Try not to sound so pleased.
CARLISLE: Well, he hasn’t exactly improved the chances for peace, has he.
NYSSA: I'd better go and find him.
CARLISLE: I'll come too.
NYSSA: Er, what about the peace talks?
CARLISLE: What about them?
NYSSA: Shouldn’t you prepare for them?
CARLISLE: Well, I imagine I could.
NYSSA: Lord Carlisle.
CARLISLE: Mmm?
NYSSA: Those papers I knocked over. They were yours, weren’t they?
CARLISLE: Yes. Why?
NYSSA: Well, one of them
CARLISLE: Faye.
NYSSA: Faye, what is it? What’s wrong?
FAYE: (crying) Those Naxy players, the violence. I couldn’t believe. I couldn’t believe.
CARLISLE: But you’ve seen the recordings of the games.
FAYE: It didn’t seem as real on television.
NYSSA: Faye, did you find the Doctor?
FAYE: We'd got right down to the pitch, when Destry just ran off. It was then that I noticed the bodies. The blood was everywhere.
NYSSA: I know, I know. Lord Carlisle.
CARLISLE: I'll look after her. You go and check on the Doctor.
NYSSA: Thank you.
HOLLIS: Come on, lads. It’s all good. We'll get ‘em back tomorrow. The Gora’ll come out all cocky and that’s when my blade gets thirsty. Whack! Thwack! Wait and see.
DESTRY: Hollis.
HOLLIS: Hey, yeah, Coach.
DESTRY: My office. Now.
HOLLIS: Coach, I just want to say
DESTRY: How dare you! (thump) You let that amateur, the Doctor, make fools of us.
HOLLIS: He... we had an off day, Mister Destry, that’s all.
DESTRY: How many strikers did we loose today?
HOLLIS: I don’t know. Couple of hundred.
DESTRY: Four hundred. Zakis, Belok, many of our best gone like that.
HOLLIS: But we're still way up for the year.
DESTRY: Not for long at this rate.
HOLLIS: I'll get them back next Game.
DESTRY: Yes, you will. Beginning with the Doctor. You’re going to make sure his Naxy career ends as quickly as it began.
NYSSA: Doctor!
DOCTOR: I told you, I will not sign any autographs. I... Nyssa.
NYSSA: I’m so relieved you're all right.
DOCTOR: Yes, well, so am I.
NYSSA: What’s this about autographs?
DOCTOR: The Gora faithful seem to have made me their new Naxy superstar.
NYSSA: I was so frightened for you. I told Lord Carlisle that
DOCTOR: Lord Carlisle?
NYSSA: Yes.
DOCTOR: You’ve met him?
NYSSA: I have.
DOCTOR: Well, what’s he like? Did you get a picture?
NYSSA: Doctor!
DOCTOR: Nyssa.
NYSSA: He’s very... nice. And I did not get a picture.
DOCTOR: How close did you get?
NYSSA: As close as I am to you now.
DOCTOR: How did you ever manage to do
NYSSA: He was in a private meeting when I accidentally sort of barged in.
DOCTOR: You barged in on
NYSSA: I was lost.
DOCTOR: Nyssa.
NYSSA: Doctor.
DOCTOR: I said be discreet.
NYSSA: Well, you should talk.
DOCTOR: Yes, fair point. Come on.
NYSSA: Where?
DOCTOR: The Tardis. I need to wash off this face paint. The negotiation’s tomorrow and I can’t very well meet Darzil Carlisle looking like this.
HOLLIS: I won't do it.
DESTRY: You have no choice, Hollis.
HOLLIS: I don’t care. I ain’t wasting my one-on-one challenge on him.
DESTRY: The Doctor is a threat. He must be eliminated.
HOLLIS: But Coach!
DESTRY: The Gora are desperate. Their dying regime views this as the moment to strike, thinking that we’re vulnerable. They’re wrong. Hollis, the Doctor cannot be allowed to encourage our enemy. Eliminating him is an honourable thing to do.
HOLLIS: But what about Sharz?
DESTRY: What about him?
HOLLIS: Sharz eliminated my father, my brother Milz.
DESTRY: Yes, I know. And deep down you think he’ll eliminate you too.
HOLLIS: Let me use my one-on-one challenge against him, and I'll show you who does the eliminating.
DESTRY: Yes, very impressive. Still, you may get your wish.
HOLLIS: What do you mean?
DESTRY: If we’re lucky, there may not even be a one-on-one challenge tomorrow. You remember Darzil Carlisle?
HOLLIS: Who? That old Earth man? Sure.
DESTRY: He is a peace negotiator. He came to Cray to end Naxy.
HOLLIS: What!
DESTRY: I’m only telling you because, as my star striker, you are to attend the peace talks with me.
HOLLIS: But, end the Game? We're so close to winning.
DESTRY: It’s for the good of our entire world. If Sharz accepts my terms, your challenge to the Doctor can be dismissed. But if the talks fail, if the Game goes on, you have no choice but to eliminate him.
DOCTOR: Leave Cray.
NYSSA: Yes.
DOCTOR: Why?
NYSSA: It’s too dangerous.
DOCTOR: But don’t you want to see how Lord Carlisle ends the war? What's wrong? You're hiding something from me, aren’t you?
NYSSA: I found this in Lord Carlisle’s quarters.
DOCTOR: Some sort of balance sheet. So?
NYSSA: Read the back. His name isn’t on it, but
DOCTOR: Prolong hostilities in the Cray Naxy conflict. Where was this?
NYSSA: Mixed in with his papers.
DOCTOR: You're positive they were his?
NYSSA: Don’t you believe me?
DOCTOR: Nyssa, this man is the greatest force for peace
NYSSA: In the cosmos. So you keep telling me. But you’ve never met him, have you. I think he was friendly enough, but, well, what if he’s not who you think he is?
DOCTOR: This note could just be something he’s investigating.
NYSSA: It’s from a private channel, authorised to Darzil Carlisle. And what about the rendezvous point.
DOCTOR: Terrace Diva, Arena Bells. Very well, then.
NYSSA: What are you doing?
DOCTOR: Seeing if the Tardis has picked up any unusual transmissions. Cray is a fairly isolated planet so it shouldn't take long to find out if
NYSSA: Anything?
DOCTOR: No. No trace of a signal to anywhere off-planet. Wait a moment.
NYSSA: What is it?
DOCTOR: It may be a common link signal to a nearby satellite.
NYSSA: Common link? That’s to anyone who wants to pick it up, right?
DOCTOR: Yes. Nothing suspicious about that, but there’s a shadow signal sort of hiding underneath it.
NYSSA: Is that possible?
DOCTOR: Well, as I’m looking right at it, I would tend to think so.
NYSSA: Who’s sending it?
DOCTOR: I can’t be sure, but it’s bouncing down to another location on Cray.
NYSSA: Where?
DOCTOR: Where? Yes, well, judging by these rough coordinates from the Tardis maps, it’s a place the locals refer to as Arena Bells.
NYSSA: Arena Bells.
DOCTOR: Get some sleep, Nyssa. Tomorrow morning we're paying a visit to Lord Carlisle.
CARLISLE: Privacy channel four. Carlisle, 10028. Yes, it’s me. The situation here is... So you say. But I still don’t like it. I can’t afford any disappointments. I want to know everything you intend to do.
NYSSA: Shall I bring your camera?
DOCTOR: No. Best not this time.
NYSSA: What are you going to say to him?
DOCTOR: Apart from hello? Not entirely sure.
FAYE: Nyssa.
NYSSA: Faye.
FAYE: I thought that was you. Hello.
NYSSA: Hello. You’re feeling better then.
FAYE: Much better, thanks. If anything, what I saw yesterday made me even more determined to end Naxy.
NYSSA: Oh, sorry, Doctor. This is Ambassador Faye Davis.
DOCTOR: Pleasure to meet you, Ambassador.
FAYE: Likewise. So is this blue box your spacecraft?
NYSSA: On good days.
FAYE: Pardon?
DOCTOR: Ignore Nyssa’s pedestrian comedy. How did you find us?
FAYE: Sharz. He and I were just reviewing the protocol for this afternoon’s talks. He said he first met you at a pub around the corner, so I decided to have a wander and look for you. Didn’t think I’d actually find you though.
DOCTOR: It would seem unlikely.
FAYE: Oh, before I forget, Doctor. Coach Destry wants to see you.
DOCTOR: Destry? He’s the one trying to end the Game?
FAYE: Right. I was about to go meet with him. You can join me if you like.
NYSSA: Won’t Sharz mind the Doctor conferring with a rival coach?
FAYE: Doubt it. It was Sharz who told me Destry wanted to see him.
NYSSA: Perhaps you should go with Faye while I talk to Lord Carlisle on my own.
DOCTOR: What? No, I don’t think I
NYSSA: Look, you can always join me later.
DOCTOR: Very well. I’ve waited this long. What’s a few more hours? Lead on, Ambassador.
GARNY: [OC]: Should be an exciting Game tonight. Earlier today I had a chance to speak with Lineen coach Bela Destry, after last night’s devastating loss.
DESTRY: [OC]: This setback only makes our task clearer. The Lineen have many advantages in this Game of Naxy. We have resolute players, we are vigilant, and we know our honour must be defended. Our team is focussed and unwavering. We've an effective plan of battle and the flexibility to meet every challenge.
SHARZ: Switch it off, Feeb.
DESTRY: [OC]: Nothing, nothing will divert us from our clear and
SHARZ: Switch it off or I'll switch it off with my fist!
DESTRY: [OC]: And we will prevail.
SHARZ: We'll see who prevails, Mister Destry. The Gora may be down, but you'll soon see we ain’t out.
FAYE: We're on Arena Bells.
DOCTOR: Right now?
FAYE: It surrounds the whole Naxy pitch.
DOCTOR: I see.
FAYE: Bells is the Cray word for surrounding road. Arena Bells is massive, but it’s usually pretty dead unless
FAYE: there’s a Game on.
DOCTOR: This is your first visit to Cray?
FAYE: Yes. Why?
DOCTOR: You seem remarkably well-informed.
FAYE: Well, it’s not too hard to grasp the basics. Because of its geology, Cray only has one major city. The virtual tours are a big help too.
DOCTOR: And what do the virtual tours say about a place called Terrace Diva.
FAYE: I don’t (faints)
DOCTOR: Faye? Faye!
BUTLER: Lord Carlisle? Sir?
CARLISLE: Oh, what now?
BUTLER: You have a visitor.
CARLISLE: Oh. Nyssa. Er, sorry. One moment.
NYSSA: Preparing for the negotiations?
CARLISLE: Er, yes. On a break. Butler, some tea for our guest. Some tea! My robot butler. I have to shout. The thing’s gone deaf in one sensor. I’ve tried to have it repaired, but er... So, to what do I owe this visit?
NYSSA: A simple question. What do you know of Terrace Diva at Arena Bells?
DOCTOR: Are you feeling better?
FAYE: Just a bit woozy. I’ve been fighting off some kind of virus ever since I got here.
DOCTOR: Your eyes.
FAYE: What about them?
DOCTOR: They're blood-shot.
FAYE: It’s probably just an allergy.
DOCTOR: You should rest.
FAYE: No, I’m fine. Let’s get going.
DOCTOR: Perhaps you’re overworked. The stress must be
FAYE: I said I’m fine.
DOCTOR: Very well. Hmm.
FAYE: What?
DOCTOR: This coin. It was on the ground there.
FAYE: Are you that hard up for cash?
DOCTOR: It’s from the Bank of Galtry.
FAYE: Galtry? Galtry is on the other side of the galaxy.
DOCTOR: Well, the galaxy has many sides, but your meaning is clear. Why would it be on a Cray pavement?
FAYE: Doctor, Destry’s waiting.
DOCTOR: That’s another thing. Why is Coach Destry so determined to end the Game?
FAYE: Death’s not a good enough reason?
DOCTOR: According to Sharz, the Lineen are on the verge of winning the Game outright.
FAYE: Doctor, the Game is a war.
DOCTOR: I know, but think about it. The Gora are on the brink of total elimination. Why should Desitry end Naxy when he’s so close to victory?
FAYE: I don’t know.
DOCTOR: Neither do I. Let’s go and see if we can’t find out.
NYSSA: So you’ve never heard of Arena Bells?
CARLISLE: Afraid not. Is it important?
NYSSA: It may be. Or it may be nothing.
CARLISLE: Sorry I couldn’t be more helpful.
NYSSA: No, it’s fine. I’m rather relieved, actually.
CARLISLE: Well, I should get back to work.
NYSSA: Yes. Lord Carlisle?
CARLISLE: Hmm?
NYSSA: What makes you do it?
CARLISLE: Do what?
NYSSA: Bring peace to so many places.
CARLISLE: Oh, well, I don’t know. It just sort of happens.
NYSSA: The Doctor says you’ve saved billions of lives.
CARLISLE: Yes, and he would know, wouldn’t he. Although according to you, the Doctor’s never met me.
NYSSA: Of course not.
CARLISLE: Twaddle.
NYSSA: What?
CARLISLE: That’s twaddle.
NYSSA: What's twaddle?
CARLISLE: Whatever twaddle is, that’s it.
NYSSA: Are you saying you’ve heard of the Doctor before?
CARLISLE: Heard of him? He’s my best friend.
DESTRY: Do you smoke, Doctor?
DOCTOR: Never.
DESTRY: Pity. (lights up) I'll get right to it. We want your approval of the new Doctor Naxy boot. We’ve got several patterns which Marketing has been sitting on. I think the best of them is probably
DOCTOR: I’m sorry.
DESTRY: About what?
DOCTOR: What does this have to do with me?
DESTRY: What, didn’t Sharz explain how this works?
FAYE: How what works?
DESTRY: The Balance Statute. Each team handles the other’s marketing and promotions. Take Hollis. Anything with his face on it is selling like mad right now, but every penny made from selling Hollis boots, Hollis shirts and Hollis posters goes to the Gora. The reverse is true for us.
FAYE: You mean you’re actually marketing the enemy? Why would you do that?
DESTRY: To keep the Game competitive. The team which loses on the field gets the resources to invest in better equipment, more sophisticated training machinery. Eventually the losing team becomes the winning team and the pattern reverses.
DOCTOR: So the Game need never end.
DESTRY: Precisely. But with all our Lineen victories we’ve been lacking financially these past few seasons, and that’s why when a Gora like you pops up, we have to exploit him to the fullest. I’m grateful to finally sell something which doesn’t have Sharz’s ugly face on it.
DOCTOR: I’m afraid I won’t be participating in any marketing schemes. Your little death machine is running fine without my help, thank you.
DESTRY: Please yourself. You'll earn us money whether you cooperate or not.
FAYE: You are merchandising his image to promote slaughter and death.
DESTRY: Our system is designed to keep the Game honest, Ambassador.
DOCTOR: Yes, because honest annihilation is far preferable to the dishonest kind.
DESTRY: I am one of the few people working to change the system, Doctor, but the only way I can do it is from within. I suggest you join me. Now, about that Naxy boot.
CARLISLE: I’m a fraud. My reputation is a sham, it’s a ruse, a deceit. Oh, I’m running out of synonyms. Did I already say fraud?
NYSSA: Lord Carlisle, calm down. Start at the beginning.
CARLISLE: I don’t actually do what I’ve been doing for the past fifty years..
NYSSA: All right. Start before the beginning.
CARLISLE: Nyssa, it isn’t Darzil Carlisle who is the greatest force for peace in the cosmos, it’s the Doctor.
NYSSA: But he’s never met you.
CARLISLE: He has, only, only his past is my future. Er, wait, no, other way round. Yes. No. Yes.
NYSSA: Lord Carlisle.
CARLISLE: The Doctor is my secret peace weapon. Every negotiation I ever negotiated, he negotiated. Well, apart from Zarek Four.
NYSSA: What happened on Zarek Four?
CARLISLE: Oh, it’s not important. The point is, without his help I’ll never end the war on Cray.
NYSSA: But he came here to see you end the war.
CARLISLE: Well then, we’re doomed, aren’t we.
NYSSA: But after all those negotiations you must have learned something?
CARLISLE: The Doctor did everything. At one negotiation I only showed up for about two minutes in total. He made me take all the credit, of course.
NYSSA: But why would he ever do that?
CARLISLE: I don’t know. He never told me. I’m nothing special, Nyssa. All I ever really wanted to do was to be a musician, and I was. And a good one, too. Until the Doctor came along and turned me into some icon for peace. Oh, don’t get me wrong, I adore him. He’s looked after me again and again. But he’s made a ruddy great mess of my life.
NYSSA: You’re respected and admired throughout the cosmos.
CARLISLE: That’s what I mean. A mess.
CARLISLE: Yes?
GUARD: We’re here to escort Lord Carlisle to the conference hall.
CARLISLE: Blast. Nyssa, make sure the Doctor attends the conference.
NYSSA: I will.
CARLISLE: And you'll be there as well?
NYSSA: Of course. I just need to locate this Terrace Diva place first.
