CARLISLE: Well, don’t take too long. Wish me luck. I really shall need it.
FAYE: We're just curious, that’s all.
DESTRY: If you must know, my desire to end the bloodshed has recently overtaken my desire to win.
DOCTOR: Which is very noble of you, but the illogical question is, why now?
DESTRY: If you’re quite through, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Destry.
DESTRY: Come.
SHARZ: Ah, Doctor. Thought you might still be here. I thought we might head over to the peace talks together, seeing as how you’re my Lieutenant.
DOCTOR: Your what?
SHARZ: Each Coach is bringing one superstar to represent them at the table. Destry chose Hollis, I chose you. So this way you and Hollis can get all worked up at the peace talks, then right after you can go and play your one-on-one Game.
DOCTOR: What one-on-one Game? Why does everyone on this planet speak so cryptically?
SHARZ: It was all over the news this morning. Hollis Az, the Lineen’s number one striker, has selected you for his one-on-one Naxy Game.
DOCTOR: Oh, I see. And this Game is to the death, presumably?
DESTRY: It’s a single elimination contest, yes.
DOCTOR: Then I refuse.
DESTRY: Well, if you refuse, Naxy rules state that thirty Gora strikers are to be eliminated in your place. You'll then be executed and buried without a grave, without honour.
FAYE: Are there any laws on this planet which favour the innocent?
DESTRY: It may comfort you both to know that the Doctor’s one-on-one would replace our normal Naxy Game, so by accepting Hollis’s challenge, Doctor, several hundred more lives would be spared. Of course, the choice is entirely up to you.
DOCTOR: It seems I have no choice at all.
SHARZ: Attaboy! Hey, for this Game, let’s get that cute little friend of yours to be a cheerleader.
DOCTOR: Her name is Nyssa, Sharz. And by now she’s probably at a place called Terrace Diva on Arena Bells.
DESTRY: Terrace Diva?
DOCTOR: Yes.
DESTRY: Was she on her own?
DOCTOR: Most likely. Why do you ask?
DESTRY: There have been several murders in that district in recent days.
FAYE: More like several thousand.
DESTRY: No, these weren’t Naxy related. It was an unknown assailant. Each victim had their neck snapped.
DOCTOR: Then Nyssa may be in great danger. Come on.
NYSSA: Hello? Hello? Can anyone hear me? This must be the place. I triple-checked those coordinates. But there’s nothing here but miles and miles of concrete walls. Is someone there? I only wanted to ask you a few questions about... I'm sorry if I disturbed you. I’m
NYSSA: Wait. Stay back. Stay!

elements.text: [Part Four]
Nyssa!
Hollis, help!
Fight.
Hollis! Hollis, are you all right?
I think so. What about you?
Just a bit shaken.
What was that thing?
I don’t know.
Where did it go?
I don’t know that either, but that wall opened, I’m sure of it.
Well, it’s sealed now
It’s a lucky thing you were around.
Not really. The Lineen locker rooms are right back there.
We must find the Doctor. He might know what that thing was. Hollis! Hollis!
Nyssa, I don’t think we should talk anymore.
Why?
Because the Doctor’s your friend.
So?
I challenged him to a one-on-one Game of Naxy. The Game goes until one of us is eliminated.
What! You can’t. Hollis! Come back, Hollis.
No sign of her.
You’re sure this is the place?
I believe so.
Sharz?
Don’t ask me. I’ve never heard of Terrace Diva.
It’s a place name from back when Naxy was a less violent Game.
And only you know of it.
One of my ancestors mentioned it in his diaries. How did you hear of it, Doctor?
Nyssa saw a reference to it. What else can you tell me about these murders?
Very little. Victims disappear. A few days later their bodies turn up mauled and covered in blood.
Ah, sorry to change this lovely subject, but
Peace talks.
They begin in half a Rev.
Yes, of course.
SHARzZ: And the sooner started, the sooner finished. Doctor’s going to need all the practice time he can get to beat Hollis in a one-on-one.
I won’t be playing Naxy again, Sharz.
But I told you
I understand your rules, but Darzil Carlisle is negotiating for peace today. With his guidance, the days of Naxy are well and truly over. I'll stake his reputation on it.
Hollis, why won’t you talk to me?
What do you want me to say, huh? You know none of this crazy stuff happened until all you aliens showed up.
Xenophobia’s not going to solve Cray’s problems, Hollis.
No, I know.
You don’t want to fight the Doctor, do you?
Of course not.
Then withdraw your challenge.
It’s against the rules.
Rules? Hollis, the Doctor may die because of your precious rules.
I told Destry to let me challenge Sharz instead, but he said no.
What would that accomplish?
Revenge.
For what?

Nyssa, my father was one of the greatest Naxy players ever, until the day a Gora rookie named Sharz Sevix challenged him to a one-on-one. Everyone laughed at the idea. Sharz had only retired twelve strikers in his career.
But Sharz won.
Dad’s blade attachment came loose. Sharz took advantage of him and
I’m so sorry.
Then, three cycles ago, my brother Mils challenged Sharz to a one-on-one. Sharz dropped him in the shortest time on record.
Killing Sharz won’t bring them back, Hollis.
No. But unless today’s peace talks go well, the Doctor and I will have a one-on-one Game tonight.
You mean it all hinges on Lord Carlisle?
Yeah.
Oh dear.
Could we settle, please? Settle. Doctor, please take your seat.
SHARzZ: You’re here next to me, Doc.
Nyssa is still unaccounted for.
So’s Hollis.
Well, we'll have to begin the negotiation without them. Lord Carlisle is
Door opens.
Ah, wait. Here they are at last.
Doctor.
Nyssa.
Oh, they look a bit sweaty. What have they been up to, eh?
Shut it, Sharz.
Hollis, come and sit down.
Are you all right?
Yes, thanks to Hollis.
What happened?
Some sort of creature. I’ve never seen anything like it before.
We'll have to wait until later. The important thing now is, did you confront Lord Carlisle?
I did.
And?
He’s innocent, I’m sure of it.
What about the memo?
I didn’t mention it. I decided the fewer people who knew about it, the better.
Yes. Very wise. At least now we can sit and enjoy Carlisle’s peace-making prowess in... peace.
But Doctor, there’s something else.
Door opens.
Silence, please. All rise for Lord Carlisle.
Be seated. Ambassador?

Thank you, sir. As most of you know, our presence on Cray is designed to facilitate an amenable conclusion to hostilities which have lead to the deaths of so many of your fellow citizens. We hope you appreciate that we perform our duties impartially, and that we retain no vested interest in the outcome for either party’s benefit.
Get on with it! We’ve got a one-on-one match to win, right? Eh, Doctor?
I'd like to move on to the opening statements. Mister Destry.

Yes, er, thank you, Ambassador. We Lineen are a strong team, and honourable in the use of our strength. By acting today I hope we might save countless lives in the future. We seek peace, but if Naxy is forced upon us, rest assured we Lineen shall play with full force and meet the enemy head-on, and prevail.
Thank you, Mister Destry. Mister Sevix, your statement.
I don’t think so.
Then I yield to his Lordship, Darzil Carlisle.
Oh, er, oh yes. Now then, the er Cray situation has been a decidedly difficult one to understand. In fact er, the er
Oh, wake me when he finishes his sentence.
So, let’s see. The Gora are unhappy with the Lineen, and the Lineen are likewise unhappy. Now then. Who wants to start the ball rolling? Doctor?
Yes, Lord Carlisle?
Did you say something?
No, Lord Carlisle.
Oh. Did you want to?
No, I’m happy to listen.
Oh.

It is important to point out that there have been over fifty thousand fatalities just this season. This is, in a word, unacceptable. Naxy is a Game in which the winners are murderers, and the losers die a horrible bloody death. Gora eliminations in the past five Naxy seasons total 78349. The Lineen fatalities are not much better. 65418. A further cause for concern is the indication that this trend has led to a policy in which any injured players must be returned to the field of play within ten days. The players themselves argue that this permits them a more honourable retirement, but the fact remains that the retirement of these injured participants is tantamount to sacrifice. In most civilised cultures, the acts which are perpetrated on a daily basis here would result in the arrest and conviction of
Doctor, I need to talk to you.
Nyssa, not now.
But Doctor, Darzil Carlisle is
It’s all right, he’s done this dozens of times. He’s disarming us so we'll underestimate him. He'll pull it together.
Now, Lord Carlisle, if you’d like to continue.
I don’t know that I could say it any better than that.
Sir, if these talks conclude unsuccessfully, the Doctor and Hollis will play a Naxy Game tonight, to the death.
Yes, I know, I know. Oh blast.
Sharz, has it always been just two Naxy teams?
Nyssa!
Silence, please. Go on, Lord Carlisle.
Thank you, Ambassador. Sharz, has it always been just two Naxy teams?
No. Used to be a couple of dozen.
What, recently?
Not unless you call four hundred years ago recent.
I would.
Them other teams all folded years ago. My Granddad used to tell me Dad about going to see er, the Gora play Havik, back when he was a boy.
So all the Havik died?
They went under, yeah. Didn’t have the players, you know.
How could you not see that Naxy is destroying your world?
Nyssa! One more outburst and I'll have to ask you to leave the hall.
Naxy’s been very good to me, darling. I started out with nothing and made it all the way to Gora Coach, and without any help from my parents.
Have acare, Sharz.
Yeah. Shut it, Sharz.
Make me, punk.
Gentlemen, enough. I, I, oh. Oh God. (thud)
Ambassador.
What’s happening? What’s wrong with her?
What’s it look like. She’s collapsed. Hollis, help her up.
No! Don’t touch me. Out of my way! All of you, keep back.
Faye! Doctor, her face was as white as a sheet.
And she was sweating profusely.
What do you think happened?
She was complaining earlier about some sort of fever.
Lord Carlisle, perhaps some sort of recess is in order. Until tomorrow?
Yes, that seems like a
Tomorrow? But the Doctor faces death tonight.
Oh. Oh yes. No, no. No recess. No.
This is a heck of a negotiation you humans run here. See you on the practice pitch, Doctor.
Wait. Sharz.
Hollis, go prepare for your match.
No, please, don’t go. Hollis.
Sorry, Nyssa. It’s my job.
Doctor, please, forgive me.
It’s never a good idea to meet your heroes, is it?
I did the best I could. I mean, I don’t even know where to begin.
Try the end. What just happened in here?
I was, I was
Your reputation has been one of the utmost esteem. The work you’ve done on behalf of peace under some of the most adverse conditions is truly a marvel, but this session was a complete failure.
But Doctor
No, Nyssa. I deserve this.
I hope you'll appreciate that I say all this within the context of the greatest respect. I certainly wish you better luck at your next Naxy negotiation.
Yes. I’m sorry. So, so sorry. (leaves)
Doctor.
It had to be said, Nyssa.
He needs help. Anyone can see that.

I know, but it doesn’t make sense. Unless every relevant history book is wrong, which happens often enough but shouldn't be the case this time. Carlisle is far too important to this galaxy’s history. The most troubling fact is that he knew what was at stake. I could see it clearly enough in his eyes.
He did his best.
It was an embarrassment, Nyssa.
I suppose so. And that’s why I’ve decided to stay on.
Stay on?
With Lord Carlisle. It just occurred to me that I might do more good as his aide.
Nyssa, I told you. Cray is where he oversaw his final negotiation before retirement.
Yes, but he'll still have tremendous influence. Perhaps, perhaps I can help him use that influence for good.
Have you discussed this with him?
I’ve only just thought of it. But once the Cray crisis is settled
Nyssa.
He needs me more than you do. It’s that simple. I never intended to travel with you indefinitely.
No. Though as it looks now, I soon may not be able to travel myself.
Knock, door opens.
Faye. Faye.
Stay away from me, Destry.
I’ve brought you something. Someone, actually. He’s here to make you feel good again.
Morian?
Look for yourself.
Hallo, darling.
Morian!
That’s right, baby. I’m back. I came back just for you.
I’m sorry that was so unpleasant.
I don’t know what he expects of me. He’s the reason I’m like this. He’s always made me feel like I can relax and let him do all the work, and now suddenly I’m supposed to do it.
He isn’t the Doctor you know. Not yet, anyway.
No, no, I know. Oh, I can’t blame him for being upset. After all, I as good as issued his death warrant today.
Lord Carlisle.
Yes? What is it, Nyssa?
Well, I was just wondering. There is still so much great work you can achieve thanks to your position. I thought I could serve as a sort of aide to you.
What about the Doctor?
He gave me his blessing.
Oh, Nyssa. All these years I’ve had to live with my secret, unable to tell anyone about how the Doctor, well, he, you know.
Then you'll accept my offer?
Of course, of course.
Excellent. Now our first order of business is to figure out a way to help the Doctor out of this mess.
Yes, yes. Just a minute. (laughs)
What?
Oh, Nyssa, our problems are solved.
Why?
I just realised. The Doctor. It’s in his future that he helps me, right?
Yes.
Well, don’t you see? If he’s going to do all that after he leaves Cray, then he must survive the Game. We, therefore, have nothing to worry about.
Have you considered the possibility that he only survives because we take action now to save him?
Oh blast. What are we going to do?
I need to see all of your paperwork about this planet.
Why?
Someone here is secretly working to extend the Game. If we can discover who it is and implicate them, we may have grounds to suspend the one-on-one, at least until the conspiracy is explored.
Well, all my papers are either in here or in Faye’s quarters.
See what you can find here. I’ll check with Faye.
What about the Doctor?
There isn’t much more we can do for him, I’m afraid.
The secret to Naxy is proper training. The right conditioning can make anyone into an athlete.
Sharz, you are not just an athlete, you are a General sending soldiers to their deaths.
Focus, Doctor. You need to be in the zone in a one-on-one.
You’ve been in a few yourself, then.
Thirty seven, won ‘em all. Obviously.
Why is it you play Naxy but Bela Destry doesn’t?

Coach is an hereditary title with them Lineen. The Destry family has always owned and coached them. The Gora, on the other hand, believe that particular honour should to the striker who earns it through achievement.
So as Gora coach, you own your team?
Yeah.
What if you’re eliminated?
The next best player takes over. All right, that’s time.
Could you ever just stop playing?
Quit? I’ve got a wife and son to support.
Ason? So he'll be out in the field some day.
That’s the plan.
Risking his life for a few magazine covers and a few dollars he'll be lucky he survives long enough to spend. You must be very proud.
SHARzZ: It’s an honour to represent your team.
There’s no honour in profiting from death. Naxy must end, Sharz.
It'll end soon enough, Doctor.
What makes you so sure of that?

Because, statistically speaking, the Gora are finished. Yesterday’s win was nice, but the wheels came off the Gora Express ages ago. The Lineen have been chipping away for a long time, and lately the chips have gotten bigger. We're already stepping onto the field with fewer players than we officially report. My strikers are each worth ten Lineen, but not twenty, if you catch my meaning.
You’re that outnumbered.
Afraid so.
So why is Bela Destry ending the Game? I’m sure that’s the key to all of this. What am I missing?
You’d better figure it out soon. It’s almost Game time.
Hello again, Naxy fans. This is Garny Diblick, today sitting alongside Lineen Coach Bela Destry as
we get set for today’s special whistle to whistle coverage of the one-on-one challenge between Hollis Az and the newest Gora superstar, the Doctor.
Should be an excellent match.
Yes indeed. Any predictions, Coach?
Just the usual, Garny. The Lineen will shatter the Gora. We have resolute players, we are vigilant, and we know that we have a just cause to guide us.
Broadcast in background.
Are you sure this is everything? Are there any more documents? Faye?
I don’t know. Whatever’s there.
Broadcast turned off.
I’m sorry, but that noise was distracting and we’re running out of time.
No, I’m sorry, Nyssa. I really haven’t been myself lately.
What happened during today’s talks, Faye? What really caused your attack?
You know what? Maybe you should just get on with your work.
It’s all right. I’ve found what I was looking for.
What is it?
A series of communications from Lord Carlisle’s office, transmitted along what is known as a shadow signal. I’m also noticing a name which keeps popping up. Morian.
Morian?
Do you know him?
I
These messages are exact reports on the situation here. This information is confidential.
So you think Carlisle is in league with this Morian?
No. I think someone else is using his private channel to make their secured correspondence.
It would have to be someone very close to Lord Carlisle.
Yes. Someone like you.
That's right, Nyssa.
What? No. Faye, what are you (thump, thud.)
Someone exactly like me.

There’s the starting whistle, and today’s one-on-one Naxy game is underway. And Sharz Sevix is poised in the Doctor’s corner, to offer moral support to his striker. Any thoughts of doing the same for Hollis?
I considered it, but frankly I don’t think Hollis needs any help with this match.
Clash of blades.
Hollis, you don’t have to do this. You can choose a different path, one that will help your people heal. Ow!
What a move by Hollis! A precision underswipe, and the Doctor’s leg was slashed.
It wasn’t as bad as it looked. No major damage.
All the same, Hollis is already moving in for the elimination.
How’d you like me now, huh? You like that move, mate?
Please, Hollis, I don’t want to hurt you.

Hurt me? Oh, right, I almost forgot. You’re responsible for yesterday's loss. Hundreds of my fellow Lineen were eliminated because of you. You hear that? That’s my crowd, Doctor. Lineen fans, cheering me on. They want to see you pay for what you did.
Do you really believe killing me is the honourable thing to do, or are you just in it for the money?
Doctor, what are you doing? Shut up and play the Game! Eliminate him!
Naxy has made me rich, Doctor, but we strikers use the money to feed our families.

Families. I asked Sharz about the role women play on Cray, apart from cheerleader, of course. He told me that they manufacture weapons used in these games. But they don’t manufacture their own teams weapons, no. The Gora women make the weapons used by the Lineen, and vice versa. They’re essentially making the very weapons which kill their husbands and sons!
Shut it, Doctor.
You turn a blind eye because you benefit financially when your own players die. Naxy was once a game to be proud of, Hollis, but now it’s just depravity and death.
No!
Remember what Nyssa said at the peace conference? All those other teams who are no longer there? So much death, and for what? A few dollars to spend on better blades?
Enough talk. It’s drop time.
Hollis!
I said shut it!
Hollis has just made a sensational move! He’s twisted the Doctor’s Naxy wand right out of his hands!
Very sharp manoeuvre. The Doctor is frozen with fear.
The Doctor does appear to be unwilling or unable to move. His wand remains an arm’s length away.
Pick it up, Doctor. Pick up your wand. Come on.
The crowd senses that something is about to happen. The Doctor is backing away slowly. He’s almost against the stadium wall.
What is he doing? He’s not even defending himself.
The Doctor’s now abandoned his wand, leaving him totally vulnerable.
Play the Game, Doctor. Pick up your wand and play.
No. I refuse to be a part of this.
You have to defend yourself.
I will not fight. Eliminate me if you must, Hollis, but I will not be part of something I know is wrong.
Then die, Gora. Die!
[Part Five]

No! The Doctor is right. Naxy is not a game, it’s a war. We simplify it so all we can see is us versus them. Players sacrifice themselves for nothing except to keep the game alive. I ask my Lineen team mates and all Gora strikers to join me and Coach Destry in the quest for peace, and an end to Naxy.
Thank you, Hollis. I couldn’t have put it better myself.
Unbelievable! We've just seen a mutual surrender! Coach Destry, we all heard Hollis mention you asa
Door opens
Coach Destry? Well, folks, it seems Destry is unable to comment at this time.
What now, Doctor?
Now we reconvene the peace conference and
Laser weapons fire.
What the?
Hollis, get down!

What this results means to both sides, I haven’t yet worked out. Another turn of events on the pitch! A swarm of what look like, well, I’ve never seen anything like it before. The arena walls just opened and dozens of large, fur-covered creatures have emerged. These things have snouts. They’re each firing some sort of laser pistol. It’s absolute chaos on the Naxy pitch! This sell-out crowd is rushing for cover.
That’s what attacked Nyssa.
Velosian Borloxes.
What?
Borloxes. They’re rather like dogs only they can walk on two legs. They can be trained so they wouldn’t harm a fly.
Or to be ferocious killers.
Yes, we have to get away from them fast.
But those things are everywhere, Doc. We’re surrounded.
Doctor! Over here!
Sharz?
Come on, get over here!
Best we take his advice.
But Sharz is
We don't have time to debate this, Hollis.
Laser fire.
Ah!
Doctor!
Hurry up! Those things are almost on top of us.
But the Doctor, he took the full brunt of the blast. Nobody can survive that. The Doctor’s dead.

Hollis and Sharz have just left the field, but the Doctor appears to have been eliminated. Wait. There’s someone approaching the Doctor’s body. He’s moving with ease amongst those monsters. He’s obviously, he’s obviously playing for the same team as them!

This is the one. He’s called the Doctor. Take him back to Terrace Diva. He and I have a lot to talk about. The rest of you make sure these punters stay outside of Arena Bells. Kill as many as you need to, but keep them away.
Faye! Faye!
I’m in here, Lord Carlisle.
I need to find Nyssa. The Doctor’s been hit by laser fire. There are Borloxes all over the Naxy pitch.
Nyssa’s right down there.
What? What’s happened to her?
Nothing yet. Morian wants her alive.
Morian?
Yes. You know Morian, don’t you? Of course you do, because like me, you’ve been secretly communicating with him.
How? How did you know about that?
Morian and I are lovers.
What are you going to do with Nyssa?
Same thing I’m going to do to you.
You mean (thud)
That’s exactly what I mean.
What’s happening back there?
I dunno.
Those things, they’re everywhere.
Shut up and let me think.
We have to do something. Destry.
What about him?
He’ll know what to do.
What, run and hide?
No, he’s wise. He was the first to see that Naxy was wrong.
I’m sure our hairy friends with the lasers will be really impressed with Destry’s leadership. Good luck, mate.
Where are you going?
To find my wife and son. I'll stick with them until this whole thing blows over
The reports I’m getting indicate that these creatures are terrorising the area surrounding Arena Bells. Authorities advise everyone to stay indoors.
Door bursts open, snarling.

Ladies and gentlemen, one of those creatures has just entered the broadcast booth. Rather intimidating it is, too. Several more are right behind it. The first one has turned to me. He’s pointing a weapon, which is likely a laser pistol of some kind. (weapon fires) Yes, it’s a laser blaster, all right, and well, I appear to have internal injuries. No blood. He’s aiming again. This time I must (thud)
Muzak playing.
Hello, everyone. Sorry about the unfortunate end to your Naxy entertainment. We’re just sorting out your transportation back to our orbiter.
Morian. Morian.
Yes, Mister Julijee.
What happened to the Naxy? I had a five thousand barla wager on that Hollis.

I’m afraid the match has been cancelled. Your credits will be refunded. I know you came a long way to see these games in person. We apologise for the inconvenience. We'll have you off Cray very shortly. In the meantime, the slot machines are all working fine. So, enjoy the music and have a drink on the house.
Morian.
I’m a little busy right now, Destry.
Why are you doing this? We had a deal.
Your striker Hollis didn’t stick to it, though, did he, so I decided to go with plan B.
The whole planet is in a panic.
Yes, well, Borloxes have that effect on people.
This isn’t funny.
I have work to do, Destry.
Those murders at Terrace Diva. Was it your creatures that did that?
Your fellow citizens got a little too close to my guard dogs. Now, if you'll excuse me.
What have I done? What have I done?
The Doctor groans. Slight rattle of chains.
He’s coming round.
Doctor. Doctor.
Nyssa. Where am I?
The Terrace Diva luxury boxes. One of many fine Morian hotels and casinos in this galaxy.
Ah, Ambassador Davis.
Why have you locked us up, Faye?
Morian’s orders.
Who?

Morian. Head of the Morian crime family. The tabloids back on Earth love to glamorise his exploits. The Morian Syndicate has its base on one of the outer Earth colonies, but they've obviously expanded operations to Cray.
And it’s only the beginning. Morian has so much more in store.
Faye, let us go.
It’s not so bad, is it? I know those chains are cumbersome, but the elegance of these luxury boxes more than makes up for it.
Door opens and closes. Borlox breathing.
Hi, honey, I’m home.
Hello, darling. Good day at work?
You bet. I made a killing.
Morian, release us at once.
Hey, I’m kissing here.
What are we going to do with them?
Well, only one of them’s worth anything to me. For all I care we can kill the other two.
No. They're both just as important as me.
It wasn’t you I was talking about, Mister Ego. It’s him.
What do you want with the Doctor?
Well, that all depends on what he’s got for me.
Coach? Coach, what’s going on?
Hollis, I...
The whole city is out of control. We have to do something. Coach!
He wants us to play, that’s all. Once we all start to play Naxy again things can get back to normal.
Those things have killed dozens of people. One almost killed Nyssa.
Never mind Nyssa. Morian will look after her.
Morian? That bloke in the fancy suit? Who is he, anyway?
He’s er, an associate of mine. We just have to give him what he wants.
And what does he want with Nyssa? Where are they?
I er, I don’t. I have to start the Game.
Coach Destry? Coach!
Do we have to stand? I’m getting a little old for this.
Shut up.
Lean on me, Lord Carlisle.
I’m curious, Morian. What is it that brought you to Cray?
Money, of course. Wealthy off-worlders pay me to bring them to Cray. Behind these two-way mirrors, they can watch and wager in comfort as our Naxy playing friends rip one another to shreds.
That explains the coin I found, from Galtry.
My guests occasionally get careless with their loose change. Cray has been a nice little earner for me, Doctor.
I take it you’re also responsible for that common-link satellite.
He uses it to send Naxy telecasts to his off-planet betting centres.
Faye, how could you take part in this?
How could I not? Just look at him. He’s extraordinary.
I must say, your health has improved considerably.
I know. I owe it all to Morian.
Those maladies you were suffering from at the peace talks, the nervousness, the sweating, they’re all symptoms of drug addiction.
I don’t use drugs.
Yes, you do. You just don’t know it.
Quiet, Doctor.
What’s the matter, Morian? Afraid I'll give away your secret?
I said, shut up.
What’s he talking about?
It’s nothing. Faye, honey, go and check the status of the casino guest’s shuttles.
Yes, darling. (leaves)
What did you use on her, Morian? Heroin slam? Eraser drug?
(laughs) Me.
You? And he calls me Mister Ego.
No, he means it.
You mean he’s the drug? How
Residents of the planet Mayzer emit a pheromone which can be highly addictive to many intelligent species.
What, like a love potion?
Love has nothing to do with it, Lord Carlisle. Victims have been known to suffer horrible withdrawal symptoms. It can even be fatal.
And now Morian has total control of Faye.
What better way to control the peace talks than to control one of their key sponsors.
So, when she shot Nyssa and me with that stun blaster...
Morian had preconditioned Faye to incapacitate whoever learned of his activities on Cray. In her mind she was doing nothing wrong.
(applauds) Very good, Doctor.
What I still fail to see is how you were able to alter your Mayzerian physiognomy to make you look human.
I didn’t. I’m not from Mayzer. I’m all human.
Then how did you acquire
It’s the classic story of a chemical researcher and his incredible gambling debts.
So to pay you off, he gave you that ability. But that’s horrible.
Don’t knock it till you try it, Nyssa. All it takes is one little kiss. First one’s always free.
Morian.
Sorry. Where was I? You, Doctor, have a knack for taking me away from my point.
My feet hurt.
Take these two away. I want a word with the Doctor. Alone.
I’m sorry for the awkwardness, but if you could all make your way to the shuttles.
Ambassador.
This way, please.
I need to talk to Morian. Those Borloxes won’t let me see him.
He’s busy right now, Mister Destry.
But this is important.
I’m sure it can wait.
I need to tell him that I can keep the Game going. It’s Sharz. Sharz is easy to control. If we could all just sit down and map out a plan
Look, I can’t help you. If you want to see Morian, you'll have to wait, unless you want to try going through those two.
Snarls.
I'll wait.
So, what do the history books say about this war on Cray, Doctor?
I suggest you wait and ask them yourself.
But you’re the one who travels in time. (laughs) Yes, I know your secret. Faye even confirmed the location of your blue time ship this morning.
Her arrival did seem a bit lucky.
Lucky? You think I set up these Naxy peace talks because I believe in luck? No, Doctor. Luck is for suckers.
You set up the peace talks?
Of course! Faye, Destry, they were all acting on my instructions. They never knew it was all for you. This whole Naxy negotiation was a trap to catch you. And it worked.
You had Desiry order a peace conference hoping I would turn up?

The funny thing is, I didn’t take control of Faye so she’d fight for peace. I mean, that’s what she wanted anyway. I did it so she’d keep an eye on old Darzil. Lord Carlisle was the key to the whole operation.
He’s involved in this as well?

In his way. I never used to think much about him. He was just one of those old icons everybody looked up to and respected. But then I heard a rumour about him. A consistent rumour. About how there was someone helping him end those wars. Someone who never got older. Someone who matches your description right down to that celery stalk on your lapel. I assembled a profile of you, found out you were something called a Time Lord. Getting that information wasn’t cheap, but in my business there’s always more money.
What do you want, Morian?
I want control of your time machine.
Do you?
It would certainly make the gambling biz a whole lot easier.
So you wish to use the most sophisticated machine in the universe as a tool to win bets.
I know what you’re thinking. There’s got to be a better use out there. But do you know, I can’t think of one.
Then you're even less imaginative than you look.
Yes, well, with the kind of cash I could win using your time ship, I could pretty much own the whole universe. How’s that for an imagination?
At least we’re out of those shackles.
We're still well-guarded. Morian seems so ruthless.
He’s just a street corner bully, with the good fortune to be born into an influential crime family.
Bullies can do a lot of damage if no one is willing to stop them.
Such a virtuous young woman you are, Nyssa.
Faye, you’re being used.
Morian’s acquired the Mayzerian Influence. He’s using it on you.
Is that what he’s done? Did he use it on you as well, Lord Carlisle?
What does she mean?
Lord Carlisle made a deal with Morian.
It wasn’t a deal. I was afraid Morian might try to stop the peace talks. In exchange for his non- intervention, I promised him immunity for his profiting on Naxy.
So you turned a blind eye to the corruption.
I thought it would make things easier for the Doctor. It was for the sake of peace.

You see, Nyssa? Morian thinks of everything. He’s utterly perfect, unlike our friend Darzil. In fact, the biggest surprise for me during these negotiations was discovering that the all-knowing Lord Carlisle was in reality an incompetent boob. Oh, he could pretend to be a solemn noble force for peace, but he couldn’t sustain it for very long. He never even noticed that I was keeping my personal documents inside his official
negotiation files.
So the papers I found about extending hostility were yours.
I was carrying them for Morian. I knew no one would ever dare look through Lord Carlisle’s personal work papers. Especially Lord Carlisle.
Door opens.
Think it over, Doctor. I’ll be back for your answer. Let’s go, Faye. They’re gonna need time to talk things over.
Coming, darling.
Door closes.
Doctor, you all right?
Not really.
Did he injure you?
Not really.
What’s wrong?
I just heard something very disturbing. It seems in some ways Lord Carlisle knows me even better than I know myself.
I’m disappointed in you, Destry.
I did everything you asked.
It wasn’t enough.
But the Game will resume eventually. Our plan will still work.
Our plan?
Your plan. I just need more time.
Forget it. I've decided to end Naxy myself.
But Morian!
Faye, are all the customers off-planet yet?
The last shuttle just left.
Good. (comms) Attention. This is Morian to all Borloxes. New command. All Gora team members are to be executed immediately.
What!
I repeat. Kill all Gora team members. The ones in the blue paint. Morian out.
Why are you doing this?
Because your people have to actually play Naxy for me to make money on it.
They will! They will!
After your little superstar Hollis’s speech today? I doubt it.
But the plan was always to end the game.
Temporarily, Destry, not permanently. My gut tells me Naxy is done, and all my personal investments were based on the Lineen ultimately winning.
But it can’t end like this.
Why not?
Because, because that’s not how the game’s played

Destry, all I care about is the final score. The bets I made don’t stipulate how the Gora lose, just that they do. If it has to end, it ends the way my money says it ends. You should be celebrating. You’re the Coach of the winning team.
But I wanted to win with honour.
Do you really think honour ever played a role in this game? Please. Goodbye, Destry.

Mira? Mira, it’s Sharz. We gotta get out of the city, darling. There are monsters or something. They’re killing all the Gora, players and fans. We don’t have time to pack, just grab Stez and... Honey? Mira. Stez. Oh no.
An interference on that scale is almost beyond comprehension.
You mentioned once or twice how helping me violated some Time Lord code or other, but that never stopped you.
But to take control of every negotiation, every settlement? Do you know how many wars that means I’ve ended? Thirty seven.
Thirty six.
I count thirty seven.
Not Zarik Four.
Why? What happened on Zarik Four?
It’s not important.
Door opens.
Sorry to break up your party, but time is literally of the essence. So, Doctor, are you going to show
me how your time machine works or not?
Not.
Right. Did you know that most human backs break within a fairly narrow range of pressure? Unfortunately, I’ve been unable to find the results of similar testing on Time Lords.
Morian, no!
So, in the interest of science, I will determine the exact amount of pressure it takes to shatter the Doctor’s spine. The experiment begins in five minutes. Place your bets.
[Part Six]
Morian, you can’t do this.
I’m just getting warmed up, old man. You two, grab the Doctor.
No! Faye, you have to believe us. Morian’s controlling your mind. You’ve become addicted to being with him, but you don’t love him. You love the drug he secretes.
Still sticking to that pathetic story?
Morian’s been genetically altered.
Think of all the work you did to acquire your rank. Do you think you’d give it up to be with a criminal sleaze like him?
Sure she would.
You’ve got to shake off the effects, Faye. The Mayzerian Influence can be overcome with focussed thought.
No, I love him. I love Morian.
Doctor, can we finish this discussion after Ugu here removes tongue? I said no interruptions!
Slashing of blade.
Hollis! Hollis, look out. The other Borlox.
Slash, slash, stab, thud.
Hurry, let’s go.
Lord Carlisle, let’s go.
Morian, they’re getting away!
Out of the way, you fool! The Doctor’s in my sights.
No, you can’t. Ah!
Lord Carlisle!
I have him. Keep moving.
Morian, are you all right?
Yes. Get off.
I’m sorry, I don’t
Morian to all Borloxes. There are four humans escaping Terrace Diva. Capture but do not kill. I repeat. Capture but do not kill. That particular pleasure will be mine.
Lord Carlisle groans.
Doctor, we have to stop and rest.
Very well. The Borloxes have our scent, but fortunately for us they’re not the fleetest of foot.
Lord Carlisle’s lost consciousness.
He’s dying, isn’t he.
It doesn’t look good. He saved my life in there. So did you, Hollis. Thank you for freeing us.
How did you know where we were?
Destry said you were with Morian. When they wouldn’t let me see you, I guessed something was wrong.
You’re a very good guesser.
Is Lord Carlisle fit to move?
He’s certainly not fit to stay.
Where should we go, then? The Tardis?
No. Morian will have placed guards there by now. Hollis, is there any higher ground near here? Some place which could be easily defended?
Yes. The Lineen Retirement Home. It’s not far. We could turn the place into a fortress.
A retirement home? That doesn’t sound good.
It sounds better than those approaching Borloxes. Come on!
This is it. Set Carlisle down there.
Shutter door closed.
How is he?
Unconscious. Hollis?
Yeah?
What did you say this place was?
Our Lineen Retirement Home.
It’s all coffins. Hundreds of coffins.
Four hundred Lineen were retired yesterday. They’re all brought here before burial.
So many lives. It’s tragic.
Yes, I know that now.
(weak) Doctor.
Lord Carlisle.
He’s coming round.
Doctor.
I’m here.
I need to speak to you in private.
Oh.
It’s all right. Come on, Hollis.
Are we alone?
Yes. What did you want to tell me?
The last time we were together, back on Solus Paz, you said something very strange to me.
What was that?

Just before you got into your Tardis, you looked me over with that sad stare of yours and said, you are my best friend, Darzil. You seemed to be even more melodramatic than usual. I didn’t think much of it at the time, but I expect you knew then that you’d never see me again. In your time line, I mean.
Lord Carlisle.

Darzil. Damn it, Doctor, call me Darzil like you always do. It was unfair of you to do that back on Solus Paz. You got to say goodbye to me, but I didn’t get to say goodbye to you. The real you, I mean. And now I never will. He doesn’t exist yet. So, here I am, dying, and I’m stuck with you. No offence.
None taken. Thank you for saving my life.
Just returning the favour. I still owe you several dozen.
Let’s call it even.
Ah, it’s funny. Until our meeting here on Cray, whenever you’d visited me you’d always had that sad stare. Always. Now I finally know why.
Yes.
You’ve got your work cut out for you, eh? All those wars to end. Well, Doctor, when you get to Solus Paz, say goodbye to your future self for me. (dies)
I will, Darzil. I will.
Door opens.
Doctor? Is he dead?
Lord Carlisle is no more.
Nyssa cries.
I know, Nyssa. But we have work to do. It’s time for us to end Morian’s game.
That couldn’t be him already, could it?
I don’t know. Hollis, be ready.
Boy, you Lineen sure pick some creepy hangouts.
Sharz!
The one and only.
How did you find us?
To be honest, I wasn’t looking for you. I’m only here because this looked like the easiest place to defend.
I thought you were holing up until things blew over.
My plans changed. I want to drive those monsters back to where they come from. With some help from a friend of yours.
Hello, Hollis.
Coach? You’re working with Sharz?
To get shot of Morian’s creatures.
The game’s changed, Hollis. It’s time we changed with it.
We will fight back. We are resolute people. Adversity reveals the character of our teams. But there is no greater asset
Yes, let’s not turn this battle into a Naxy game as well, shall we? It'll take more than empty rhetoric to stop Morian and his Borloxes.
We also have several hundred strikers, Lineen and Gora.
What?
They’re all waiting outside.
Everyone on Cray, men women and children, we all want to take out Morian’s alien army.
They shouldn’t be waiting long. Morian’s on his way, and we had better be ready for him when he
gets here.
That’s it, boy. Take me to them. Faye, you're falling behind! Faye!
Yes.
What's wrong with you? Keep up. The Borloxes move slowly enough as it is. You’re not starting to doubt our love, are you, babe?
No, I don’t er, I mean, I
Come here. There, that’s better. Now, come on.
Yes, darling.
He’s coming. They’re at the base of the hill. I counted two dozen of those creatures with him.
Is that all? Good, good.
The sun’s already gone down. Maybe you didn’t see all of them.
No, they’ve got torches. And some of those Borloxes are dragging something big behind them.
Could it be the Tardis, Doctor?
Possibly. Right, keep your weapons down. They won’t be much use against their laser rifles. Is everyone outside in position?
Just as you instructed, Doctor.
The rest is up to us. Get to your places, everyone.
Nyssa? A word?
Yes, Hollis?
I just wanted to say that I appreciate everything you’ve done for me.
What do you mean?
You helped me see what was really happening here, with Naxy and everything.
Hollis, I didn’t do anything.
No, you did. You did. You showed me how it’s important to question the way things are. You’ve made me a better person.
It’s very nice of you to say.
Anyway, I’d love to marry you.
What?
Assuming we survive all this, of course.
Of course.
Don’t you want to marry me?
I’m very flattered, but I’ve, I’ve learned that when I’ve tried to get close to someone things don’t usually work out very well for them.
I don’t understand.
It’s not easy to explain. But your place is here, with your people, and my place is with the Doctor, at least for now. I’m sorry.
I thought as much. But since we'll probably all be dead soon, I didn’t think I’d have much to lose.
That’s the spirit.
They laugh.
Quiet.
Snarling outside.
They’re here.
Keep your weapons down.
Door broken down.
Greetings and salutations. So, we’re all here at last.
Not quite all of us.
Is that Lord Carlisle down there?
It is.
He looks dead.
He is.
Guess I can inform my secretary that we have a winner in the Darzil Carlisle dead pool.
Morian, you have slain a man who was a hero to millions. You’ve murdered a
Must you always be so dull? Hero, blah blah blah. Injustice, blah blah blah. The universe is not a nice place, Doctor. Let’s move on, shall we?
His death is on your hands.
Oh, I don’t see it that way. If you’d given me control of your time ship, he’d probably still be alive. If you look at it that way, his death is on your hands. And guess what? Nyssa’s next.
No!
Hollis.
I'd keep back if I were you, kid. My furry friends don’t like it when people threaten me. Well, I admit
you throw quite a party, Doctor. I don’t see the bar anywhere, but these coffins will be coming in handy very soon.
Have you no respect for the dead, Morian?
Destry, is that you? Finally grew a backbone, did you?
Shut it, Morian.
What's it to you, kid?
Mister Destry is my Coach.
Wow. Hollis is loyal, isn’t he, Destry? It’s almost (laughs) It’s almost as if he didn’t know you killed his father.
What?
Morian, no.
Your father’s wand didn’t malfunction, Hollis. Destry tampered with it.
Why would Destry ever do that?

To stop his team’s momentum. You see, Hollis, your Daddy was too good at Naxy. The Game was about to end, so Coach Destry took matters into his own hands. You see, it’s a little hobby of mine to find moral loopholes in people. Destry’s is greed.
Coach?
He’s lying, Hollis. Don’t listen to him.
Destry receives part of your gambling profits, doesn’t he? That’s why he agreed to set up the peace talks even though he was winning the Game.

Exactly. Naxy was only a few weeks from ending. After I came up with the genius idea of twinning Cray and Earth, all Destry had to do was ask for help, and the dearly departed Darzil Carlisle was brought in to end the Game. But only temporarily. The plan was that once the Gora’s ranks were built back up, Naxy would start all over again. Of course, I would have made sure the Gora always lost more games than they won.
But we win by combat. How could anyone make the Gora lose?
By making sure just enough of the Gora’s equipment doesn’t work.
A few bad wands here, a few bad boots there. It’s quite easy.
All this time? Destry, you traitor.
It’s very shrewd of him, really. He’s cracked the code. When his Lineen lose, he profits in Gora merchandise. If they win, I cough up his share of the winnings.
Is this true, Coach?
Oh, go on, Coach, answer him.
Yes.
You killed my father for money?
I’m so sorry, Hollis.
I was running out of cash. We kept winning but we were losing money. If the Game had ended then, I would have been bankrupt.
So, when I offered him a piece of the gambling money to arrange your father’s death and extend the Game, he agreed.
I didn’t want to do it. The Destry’s have always been respected. I couldn’t let myself become a pauper. My family honour was at stake.
Where’s your honour now, Destry?
You may have destroyed me, Morian, but I can still destroy you!
Destry, stay back!
Snarl, slash, gnawing, screams.
Mmm, not pretty. All right, down, boy, down. Don't fill up on appetisers. Save some room for the main course.
Haven't you caused enough pain?
Well, that’s up to the Doctor. This all ends once I get that time machine.
It’s already ended, Morian.
Has it now? I don’t
Listen.
I don’t much like the tone
I said, listen. (singing outside) Hear that? The hill we’re standing on is surrounded by thousands of very angry Naxy strikers..
What are you talking about?
I know they’re probably finishing off what’s left of your Borloxes. This time you’ve been caught in my little trap, Morian.
Very clever, Doctor.

Thank you, Hollis. Morian never expected the Gora and the Lineen to forget their hatred so quickly, and unite. Centuries of war ends in a matter of minutes thanks to you, Morian. You turned out to be the greatest peacemaker of us all.
Trayda, keep them away from me.
So now it’s just you and one Borlox against the whole of Cray.
I don’t fancy those odds.
Neither do I. Come on, Faye. Faye! I said, come on!
But I don't, I
You don’t have to go, Faye. We know you’re not responsible for your actions. We can help you to put things right again.
Yes, I, no. No, Morian loves me. You’re all conspiring to hurt me. Only he can take care of me. Only Morian has what I need.
No, Faye, you mustn’t
Nyssa, stay back.
Too late, Doctor.
No! Let me go!
Nyssa!
Keep back!
Morian, if you hurt her...

I’m leaving Cray, Doctor, with Nyssa as my hostage. Of course, once the Mayzerian factor works its way into her system, she'll be only too happy to stay as my guest. But never fear, Doctor. You and I will meet again. Bet on it.
Nyssa, get down!
No!
Blade slashing.
One down, one to go.
I told you to keep back. Maybe you'll listen to this.
No!
Laser fire.
I’m fine, it just grazed my shoulder, thanks to Nyssa mucking up the shot.
My pleasure. Your distraction allowed me to get free.
But look, Morian and Faye, they’re getting away.
But they'll run straight into a thousand Naxy strikers.
I doubt they'll stop him in time.
In time for what?
That sounds like a rocket blast.
Yes. Morian’s personal escape ship.
But how did he reach it so soon?
It must be what he had the Borloxes drag up from the casino.
You mean Morian brought an escape shuttle up here as a precaution?
That was lucky.
I don’t think so. Morian doesn’t trust anything to luck.
Poor Faye.
Indeed. But I doubt that’s the last we’ve seen of Morian. He caught me by surprise this time. I won't make the same mistake again.
How’s your shoulder?
Fine, thanks to Nyssa. That was some move you made back there, darling. You’d have made a great Naxy striker.
Could it be you’re finally seeing women as something more than cheerleaders?
Point taken.
So you’ve identified all of the off-world gamblers?
Yes. And sent their names to Earth. They'll be held accountable for profiting off the Naxy deaths.
Well done, Hollis. This leadership role suits you.
I taught him everything he knows.
I still can’t believe Lord Carlisle’s gone.
He didn’t die in vain. I made it clear to the Earth authorities that he should get the credit for bringing peace to Cray.
And it’s true, in a way. I mean, it was his arrival that started the ball rolling.
His thirty eighth and final peace accord.
But Doctor, didn’t you tell me Darzil Carlisle retired after ending the war here?
Yes. Unfortunately, in Cray vernacular, he has.
Tardis door opens.
Come on, Nyssa. It’s time we were off.
You sure, Doctor? You’re welcome to stay as long as you want.
We may come back and see how you're getting on. In the meantime, maybe the two of you could
think up a pastime where losing isn’t quite so lethal.
Will do, Doctor.
Well, goodbye, Hollis.
Goodbye, Nyssa. (kiss)
And good luck.
Tardis door closes, the Tardis dematerialises.
It would have worked. I know I could have helped Lord Carlisle live up to his reputation.
He was still a good man.
Yes. You never did get your photo with him, did you?
No. But it seems I'll have plenty more opportunities. I have three dozen wars to end, remember? Well, as one of my lecturers at the Academy used to say, no time like the present.
Doctor?
Hmm?
I’m sorry, it’s, it’s just I don’t think I could bear seeing Lord Carlisle again. Could you, could you possibly deal with those wars after I’ve gone?
Of course. Of course. Go and get some rest, Nyssa. We have all the time in the world.
